Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	The words of Albucaisem begin thus.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, because it has reached its end through me and my consequences, and through my explanations and declarations, it seems to me that you should complete that which is in this treatise, which is part of my surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Since my surgery is neglected in our region and in our time, completely private, so that the science of it is almost forgotten, and its practice remains hidden; and there remain only a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which are changed to the most part and added to those errors and aberrations, until the intentions of it are closed and its force and art are elongated.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that you should revive that ancient order of this treatise in accordance with the way of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and so that you may acquire the forms of the instruments of cauterization and other tools of the craft as if by addition to the declaration, and for preparation thereto, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	However, the reason why there is not found a good craftsman in our time who has mastery of his hand in this art, is that the art of medicine is long and tedious, and it requires one's actor to be exercised beforehand in the science of anatomy, which Galen recognized, so that he may know the joints of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and have knowledge of the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their number, and the arrangement of them; and of the pulsating and quiet veins, and the places of their efflux.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore Hippocrates says that a name is not a motive, but rather in small work, and most of all in the art of surgery.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already spoken of that in the introduction to this book; for one who is not skilled in what we have said about anatomy is not fit to be a surgeon, lest he fall into error by which men will die, as I have seen many of those who are thus formed in this science and gain nothing from it, but rather lose their science and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor who had inserted an abscess of scrophulous humor into the neck of a woman, and he had cut through some arteries of the neck so that a great deal of blood flowed, whereby the woman died between them.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who thought he would pull out an abscess from a man's groin which had developed in his state, and the abscess was large, and it came to him and removed that abscess with a piece of the bladder, whereby that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I had already called out to him to remove it, and I saw that because of the size of the abscess and the condition of the patient he knew it would kill him.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took a stipend from a duke in our land for surgery, and he proceeded to operate on a blacksmith's son who had a fracture in his thigh; and the doctor, with his ignorance, extracted the bone, placing it above the wound, using pillows and splints with excessive tension, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he released the dressing according to his own desires, and released the splint, and released it for several days, commanding that we remove the bandage; and it happened thus that the thigh and leg became inflamed, and perished.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to remove the bandage, and achieving calmness and easing his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But meanwhile corruption was confirmed in the member, so that I could not restrain it, and it did not cease to corrupt the member until the patient perished.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who pierced a cancerous abscess, and made it ulcerate after some days, until the pus magnified the evil of it with its lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which cause is that the cancerous part is pure of melancholic humor, whereas it does not need to be brought to him with all force, but rather should be left as a member which suffers and is completely hostile.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the surgery with me be divided into two divisions: one is in operation which is associated with health, and the other is in work where danger is involved in the greatest circumstances.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed here in every place of this book where operation is in the wrong and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to keep this and set aside that, so that foolish ones do not find a way to speak and to deceive you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take up your own arms with solicitude and protection of God, and your own patients with felicity and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method by the grace of God to achieve health and praiseworthy success, and put aside terrible diseases that are difficult to heal, and keep your own arms away from this which makes you fear, so that you may situate yourself in your faith and in your own name, not being deceived: for it remains to your glory, and even more so in the world and finally to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Galen already said in some of his own writings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"Do not heal bad diseases, lest you be called a bad doctor."
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and the first part of the first chapter.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter, ordered by the head to the feet, in the forms of instruments and in the furnishings of cauterization, and from which it is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on dryness and puncturing, and on sponges, and wounds, and extraction of splinters and similar things, all chaptered and ordered according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on curing of fractures and similar things; chapter ordered from head to feet, and according to the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cauterization with fire and sharp medicine, and on remembering the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that begins the treatise of this entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I should say what quality the joints have of that cauterization and what injuries it inflicts on them, and in what condition cauterization is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	So I say that the discourse on the quality of the joints in cauterization and its injuries is a long and prolix sermon, subtle by science, and secret and hidden; and already many wise men have spoken about it, and some have disagreed with each other, and for my part, I will only briefly touch on some of their sermons, fearing prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so I say that cauterization is suitable for all complete configurations universally, which are in material or its materials, except for two configurations, which are configurations of dry matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the dry and withered configuration of material, it will desiccate; for some would say that cauterization is beneficial to it, while others would say the opposite of it, that cauterization is not suitable in a disease which is caused by quality and dryness, for nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that a dry and withered configuration with water that is hot and dry should be healed.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And say that the one who says the opposite of it is wrong, that by cauterization it is made healthy in all dry and withered diseases that are found in the bodies of men, for when you compare the human body and its humidity to the configuration of fire, you find the human body cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by this sermon that this experiment is already known to me on several occasions to uncover.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But meanwhile it is not necessary that this come to be written again in detail, since it has already been exposed and exercised in the chapter on cauterization for the last exercise, and understood the diversity of human configurations and the disposition of diseases in their own bodies, and the causes of these, and their accidents, and the space of time for these.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other configurations, there is no fear on your part, and especially in cold and humid diseases, for all doctors have already agreed on these, and are not in discord about the joint treatment with cauterization in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing through cauterization with fire and its goodness is that on top of cauterization with medicine, it is combined because fire is simple, the action of which only reaches the member that is being cauterized and does not harm another member that is adjusted to it except for a little damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of medicine combined reaches that member which is distant from it, and very quickly brings disease of difficult healing to the sick member, and very quickly increases suffering.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But the fire, by its sublimity and goodness of substance, does not do this except to superfluously. And it is already known to us through experience and the length of service in studying the art about the truth of causes; and therefore I am excused from the length of this sermon. But if it were not for the fact that it is not read well in this pause, I would reveal to you a secret hidden in the fire, and the quality of its operation in the body, and its expulsion by which it expels diseases, with a philosophical demonstrative sermon, which would be sharp in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when it is suitable to perform cauterization and pause at the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is suitable at any time, because the harm caused by the accident of time is submerged in the joint of what is attracted to cauterization, and even more so if the cauterization is for necessary pains or necessary torments, which do not suffer delay because they are feared of those who come with evil, which is greater than small damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus it does not sit in your minds, or, children, this is not esteemed except by the common people and foolish doctors, so that to that disease which is cured by cauterization there is no reduction of time, and pause is taken for the consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus, as they think by this, because cauterization is only in a place of medicine that alters the configuration and dries out the humors which are the cause why pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But meanwhile, cauterization is excessive above medicine by virtue of its validity and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his disease may return at some hour of time, according to the configuration of the patient and the location of his disease, and the virtue of him, and what is prepared in his body through the accumulation of superfluidities there, and what is brought to him through acquisition of victuals and similar things to those causes; but if the disease that is administered cauterization is a subtle disease in a member with few superfluidities and humors, just as cauterization of teeth for pain and similar things, it is possible that in him that pain may not return, but rather it will be reduced.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And besides, it is common speech that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, and it is a dubious saying, not in what I understand there, because I believe that there is no cure that profits by medicine or any other cause approaching cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and my understanding is that cauterization is the last resort of medicine only when one administers the methods of cure in some diseases, and those medicines do not concur, and just at the end of the cause one minimizes cauterization, and it profits thereby.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And I see now that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, not according to my understanding which understands the common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cauterization does not make a difference, as long as it is absolutely true, because I have already shown and proved that it does not do this except in certain bodies, and cauterization with gold is good and better than with iron, just as they say; but meanwhile, when you perform cauterization with fire on aurum, it is not to be declared, because it is unknown according to the quantity you wish for the roughness of the aurum, and since it prepares to receive heat; and if you adjust over it ignition so that the aurum melts by the fire, and a case occurs in the fire where some plates are formed so that the artisan can see through the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And therefore, it is made to perform cauterization with iron in a way that we must be more lightly and more promptly guided towards the correctness of operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already organized this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and I have organized those from head to feet, so that it may be easier for the one asking about it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On Cauterizing Headaches Caused by Coldness and Humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The First Chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization refers to the humidity and coldness that occurs on the surface of the accident, which has two causes: one is caused by soda and the other is caused by a torrential flow of rheumatic fluid, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the eyes and ears, and also due to excessive sleep, toothache, and yawning, and universally all diseases that come through coldness, such as paralysis, sogginess, apoplexy, and similar things in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is as follows: first, I command the patient to be evacuated with laxative medicine in the morning, for three or four nights, according to what the virtue of the patient and their age and habit demands.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then I command him to shave his head with a razor, and afterwards make it smooth between the hairs on top of a well-crafted bench, and have him rest his head on the stone floor.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then pause the razor's edge on your palm above the nose between your eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But meanwhile, when your mouth says the middle part is reached, mark that place with a tent, and then ignite the olive cauterization of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then pause that on the marked place with a tent, in a way that it descends, by which your thumb is gradually constricted little by little, and you revolve it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and look at the place, and if you see that some quantity of bone has been uncovered on the skull, just as the amount of grain of errors, then raise your hand, and if it does not return to its original position with that iron, but is cooled down, until what I have said to you becomes visible.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it over the place, and let it sit for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then pause on that spot surrounded by borders and let it stay there until the scar of fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the place with four-leaf gentian medicine until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that the more the wound remains open, the better it gets, so that it is more helpful and beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that some of theirs should be cauterized with a red-hot iron into the bone, and hold the cauterization until some part of the specificity of the bone is tempered.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove that which has been tempered with the bone, and then cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others said that with the cauterization, it reaches the end, and then presses on the bone with great force until the bone cracks, and this is the form of little alphetiation.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they think that from that place, the vapors of the head are released.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound is kept open for a long time, and then it is cured until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But to me it seems that these two species of cauterization are not visible from head to toe, but only in some men according to the way of fear; and leave it alone, I think, better is for health when it is so, because the head is revealed by solution of continuity like we have testified in other members, and even more so when the patient's head is of a fearful nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first species of cauterization is more saved and better, according to my opinion; and from that house and with that work there is health.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On Cauterizing the Head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs throughout the head in a patient, and they are prolonged in their condition, and use ointments, poultices, capes, emplasters, poultices, and similar things, and especially if it has already been cauterized with one cauterization which does not benefit or relieve the patient, then consider whether the head of the patient is prone to strong creation in its nature; and if not fearful and finds a great chill, then that cauterizes another cauterization, leaving a little bit.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize it on the crown of the patient's head with a cauterizing iron until the skull is divided.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the skull and expose the quantity of bone which we have counted, and then cauterize it with a cauterizing iron in the rear part of the head, in the place called "vas", where the wind pipe is located.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And then lift your hand away from there, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will experience a great deal of pain that is different from all the other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you will say that this cauterization is in its place, for it is necessary to cauterize the crown of the head and the occiput with a more subtle cauterization than that which is used for the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On Cauterizing Headaches Not Caused by Ancient Causes.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When headache pain is felt in the crown of the head or spreads to the eye, and evacuation with laxative medicines does not help, then another cure should be administered, which I have mentioned in the divisions of diseases; and if it does not benefit, there are two ways to cauterize: either by using acute medicine combined with a cauterization, or by using iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterization with combined medicine is when you take a piece of aloes, scrape it off, and cut off the extremities at both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then make an incision in the spot of the pain on the temple with a well-sharpened lancet until it is made into a small hole, so that it may be hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then strengthen it with a stopper made of descending constriction, and leave it for the space of three hours; and then remove the plaster and treat the aloes, and let the wound be open for two or three days, and then pause on that spot surrounded by borders until the place becomes firm.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with gentian medicine until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some combined medicines which I have written about in the two treatises on combined medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But the iron cauterization according to this manner: ignite by cauterization of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and is called "claus clavilhs", because the head of it is shaped like a clove in which there is some curvature, and in the middle part of it is a small elevation.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then pause on the spot of pain, and hold your hand steady - so that the iron is not scorched where it is left - and slowly revolve the small iron with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of blood that is scorched by the specificity of the bone is like the majority of it, and lift your hand for this reason - so that the artery which is left is not scorched, lest a flow of blood comes.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then immerse the cloth in saltwater and pause it on the spot, and leave it for three days; and then pause another cloth wrapped around the border, and cure with gentian medicine until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize at the extremity of the scalpel according to the method, and be careful not to cut into an artery in this proper non-ancient headache.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On Cauterizing Ancient Headaches.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you cure a headache with what we have said about the previous treatment and what we have said in the divisions of diseases, and if the treatment does not benefit and the disease is such that it does not reach the point where we have said about the first cauterization with medicine or with fire, then you must ignite the cutler's cauterization until it becomes white, because you signify on the spot of pain with a line of length equal to the majority of the same thing, or whatever; and pause your hand for one moment and strengthen that until you incise the artery and reach into the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to beware of the continuity of the jawbone, which is damaged by mastication, and that the ligament not be scorched and the nerve which is affected by that, and that there be no spasmodic contraction.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and caution of the flow of blood from the artery that is cut, because in the cutting of it there is fear, and especially to him who ignores what he is doing and is not studious or experienced; and leave the operation to begin.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find in memory of the regimen of accidental blood flow according to your own manner, in your place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease does not reach the point of this cauterization and you see that the patient's body is tolerable, then cauterize it in the middle part of the head just as we have recounted, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cauterization which we have said in the chapter on stretching the artery with two cloths, and it is a better cauterization and more conducive.
Capitol .v.	Fifth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On Cauterizing Earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When in the ear there is pain due to cold and it has been treated with laxative medicines and the other cure which I have mentioned in the division, and the pain is not relieved, then ignite the cauterization, and this is the one called "puncta", of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then place the puncta near the ignition, and be guided to the entire ear as if a wheel is turned around, or in the circuit of each example if the pain is in each.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Hold the cauterization of the ear's root slowly and gradually as you have indicated the location with a tentative touch.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cauterization of those points in the entire ear is done, and whichever one it may be, then cure the spots until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Sixth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On Cauterizing Turtura.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turtura which is cured and by cauterization it is nothing but the species that comes through phlegm, according to what we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the species that occurs due to dryness or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that species of turtura with jerrals and capipurgies and guarguarisms, and your treatment does not bring relief, then it is necessary for you to cauterize the patient with three cauterizations: the first at the root of the ear, and the second a little below the temporal temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause your cauterization at the opposite part of the affected side, because softening only appears on the side that seems to be healing.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cauterization in the right extremity of the ear, a little above the crown of the head, and on the temple another, the length of which is according to the length of the said thumb, and pause your hand with the cauterization until the quantity of the majority of the specificity of the bone is consumed.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauterization, and it is a species of the scalpel, the form of which is before us.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But however subtle it may be, that which you see a little bit is what you must cut off in excess of unnecessary growth.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the spot with water as it proceeds until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Seventh Chapter.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On Cauterizing Ancient Apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is ancient and you cure it with the water that we have said and your treatment does not bring relief, and the patient has no fever, then cauterize it with four cauterizations: on all the crowns of the head; and with the middle cauterization in the middle part of the head, just as we have said; and with the cauterization in the back of the neck.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the manner of the cauterization is made according to what has been said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has been cauterized at the mouth of the stomach; and it is more recent; and then it should be cured with water as it proceeds.
Capitol .viii.	Eighth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On Cauterizing Oblivion Caused by Phlegm.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	It is necessary to give the patient in the beginning large jars and pills of serving medicines that clean the mind.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then remove the cloth from the entire patient and place on the back of the neck an emplastrum described in the treatise on emplasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And pause that for a few moments, because it is the manner of cauterization.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do so according to that order which I have already said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And therefore if by those means he is healed; and otherwise, then do to him three cauterizations in the back part of his head, which are descendents of the upper part of the head down to the lower part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And pause between each cauterization the thickness of a finger, and then cure the cauterization with water as it proceeds.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you add more and the patient is thus tolerant, then do to him the cauterization in the middle part; and if you desire greater addition, then immediately cauterize that on both crowns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	And then cure it until it is healed; and be the olive cauterization according to the form previously given.
Capitol .ix.	Ninth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On Cauterizing Parasites and Softening the Entire Body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	It is necessary for you to proceed with the softening of the head with jars and water as we have said; and then remove the cloth from the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cauterization in the middle part of the head, and one on all the crowns of the head, and one on the back part of the neck, and three cauterizations on the vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the disease of softening the body of many and the patients are tolerant and the disease is strong, then immediately cauterize it with four cauterizations on the vertebrae of the back, and subsequently with one cauterization until it is consumed by the bone's motion, and lift your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then cure it until it is healed, and this be olive cauterization.
Capitol .x.	Tenth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On Cauterizing Epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not cauterized the epileptic, but that epilepsy is due to phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	And therefore it is necessary to soften the brain at the beginning with jars and other cure which we have said in the division when the disease is great and the patient is tolerant, except for medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is an infant who cannot tolerate medicines, then immediately administer guarguarisms and mastiguarists serving softening medicines, before this for many days, with the blessing of good food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then remove the cloth from the patient's head, and then cauterize it with one cauterization in the middle part of the head according to the previous manner, and another cauterization on the back of the neck, and on each crown of the head be cauterized.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and tolerant, then immediately cauterize it with the cauterizations which I say, having paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And be olive cauterization according to what has been said previously.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is an infant, then immediately pause subtle cauterization according to this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Eleventh Chapter.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On Cauterizing Melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted and gross phlegm, then immediately cauterize it with the cauterizations which we have said in the previous chapter, having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess and decline into melancholy, and the patient's body is humid, then immediately give him to drink water that softens the brain of him according to what has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then remove the cloth from the patient's head, and then make a gentle circular motion on him around the circle, and then place it in the middle part of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient shall be seated comfortably, and held from all sides.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then pause the liniment; and it is more worthy of ancient border of sheep's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And warm that over the fire with gentle heat by measure, which the patient has suffered when it is most in him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then place that in the middle part of the head of him in the circle, and let it enter until he is cooled down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do so with the patient for one week at a time, with another regimen of good things until he is healed; or if you wish, cauterize it making small points according to what is best for him, without holding your hand with a cauterization thus ordered: this is a species of cauterization which moistens the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then pause that wrapped in cloth or in gray flannel.
Capitol .xii.	Twelfth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On Cauterizing Water Descending into the Eye.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you declare the beginning of water in the eye by the signs which I have said in the division, then begin and give to drink to the patient water that softens the head of him, and guard it from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And then place that in a bath of hot water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to wash his head, and cauterize it with a cauterization in the middle part of the head; and then cauterize it with two cauterizations on both temples if there is the beginning of water flowing from both eyes, or on one side if there is the beginning of water flowing from one eye.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	And incise all the veins and arteries that are left by the bone; and be the cauterizations in that length on the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of bleeding when it is cauterized; and if you see any bleeding from it, stop it with some medicine that is at your disposal.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you will find wisdom which is in the extraction of arteries and in the excision of those and caution in bleeding.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some times it is cauterized in the vertebrae left between two bones with two cauterizations subsequently produced.
Capitol .xiii.	Thirteenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	On Cauterizing Old Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears from the eyes are old and accumulated through the veins and arteries that are in the manifest location of the head outside and it is verified that this is excessive and watery phlegm, then immediately cauterize it with a cauterization which we have recounted in the chapter on the beginning of water flowing into the eyes, and also with a cauterization in the middle part of the head and two cauterizations in the vertebrae left between two temples, and two cauterizations in the vertebrae left between two bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you need to add something, then immediately cauterize it on the entire back of the eyebrow above the upper eyelid with a small cauterization.
Capitol .xiiii.	Fourteenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On Cauterizing Stench from the Nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat him with water as we have said in the division and your treatment does not produce relief, then prepare yourself and give to drink to the patient cochineal for three nights; and then remove the cloth from the head of him, and cauterize it with a middle cauterization and olive cauterization.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize it with a clove cauterization and two cauterizations on both upper eyelids left between the hair a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to cut into that artery.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And of the clove cauterization, this is the form.
Capitol .xv.	Fifteenth Chapter.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On Cauterizing Softening of Eyelids of the Eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or humidity, then immediately cauterize that eyelid with a cauterization with this lunar cauterization; and this is the form of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish, then cauterize that over both upper eyelids a little with two cauterizations in every part, and be prolonged from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And be the length of each cauterization according to the quantity of the upper eyelid.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with your hand on the cauterization, but rather according to the quantity that the third part of the eyelid is softened.
Capitol .xvi.	Sixteenth Chapter.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	On Cauterizing the Eyelid of the Eye When the Hairs are Converted to the Inner Partitions and Punch the Eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are converted to the inner partitions so that they punch the eye, cauterize it in those places according to two manners, whether it is by fire or by a medicine that combines.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If by cauterization of fire, command the patient to hold his eyes thus as those which are cleaned, until they are prolonged and equalized; and if it pains him, then immediately you should strengthen the eyes of him with a bandage so that no harm comes to them while the hairs are growing.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they are grown and equalized, immediately pause the patient's head in your seat, and then sign above the eyelid of his eyes with a tentative sign, with a signal which is according to the figure of a mercurial leaf, and be the beginning of the signal near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place it wrapped in alum water or in pectinate mucus over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then ignite the cauterization of which this is the form of it.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure which you have signaled, little by little, in many times, until the surface of the bone which is thus like a leaf of myrtle, appears properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of health for this operation is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the hairs of it being elevated above the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And therefore elevate your hand and leave it so for three days, and then pause on top of it with cloth until the scar is educated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if some cause returns for the hairs and they become painful again, and the eyelid is softened, then immediately do another time the cauterization over it just as you did previously.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the eyelid itself, then immediately cauterize it until it is elevated to its natural place and equalized, so that the hairs do not hurt the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cauterization with a medicine that combines is this: you command the patient to hold his hairs until they are prolonged and equalized, and then make a form of a leaf of myrtle from cloth.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take one ounce of known saponin and one ounce of living cause. It seems like the text has ended! And then take what is here, and immediately mix those causes well, and make this with a fumigation so that it will not be cooled; and then expand the water on the paper which is made thus in the form of a leaf of myrtle, and pause over one eye or both; and pause below the eye wrapped in alum water, and the patient's head should be in your seat.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And then pause the said on the medicine and press it a little and not harm it until the patient feels the biting of the medicine, for biting is in it as from fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And therefore when you perceive that he endures the biting, immediately let go of the medicine and make it clean with your said; then when the biting ceases, immediately remove the medicine and wash his eye with water; and then consider if at times the eyelid is raised as if it were washed away by fire or incision, for then you are well; and if not, return to that place of medicine where no medicine has been applied and do not disdain until your operation is equalized and the eye is constricted.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then pause on top of it with cloth until the bone of adjustment is eradicated, and then cure that with ointment or another substance until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to carefully watch over your operation with diligent vigilance so that no residue of medicine falls into the eye; and if the eyelid becomes softened and some cause from the hairs hurts the eye after a few days, then immediately repeat your medicine on that place where the eyelid has become softened, and just as you did at the beginning, and then send it back until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of leaf of myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyes of men are diversified according to magnitude and smallness, and therefore according to this is made your contraction.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And may not be hidden the way of rectitude to him who studies in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Seventeenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On Cauterizing Fistula that is in the Lacrimal of the Eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure fistula with water as we have said in the divisions of diseases and it does not conform to your treatment, then immediately know that you must cauterize it according to this manner: command the patient to place his head on your seat, and hold his head steady between your knees in such a way that it is neither harmed nor agitated with his own head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place it wrapped in alum water or in pectinate mucus over the eye of him.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cauterization of which this is the form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be curved, like a shape of cane or the horn of a bull, from one end to which is made the cauterization.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, it should come out thus as if it were a test.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But in any case, the one that is curved is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press on the fistula if it is open, and draw out from him the pus and dry that up.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then immediately work on it and extract the purulence from him.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then pause on top of it with the cauterization which is well ignited, and take with your hand a little bit of the cauterized area from the edge of the nose, so that you do not err or trouble the patient, and then pause the cauterization in the gray matter of the eye and corrupt that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And therefore if at the beginning of your cauterization it goes into the bone, that is good; and if not, then immediately repeat the cauterization one or two times, as needed; and leave it thus for three days, and then pause on top of it with cloth and surround it with drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if it has been passed eleven days and it is not healed, then immediately pause on top of it with acute corrosive medicine until the bone is uncovered and is rough as is fitting in your own chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another manner of cauterizing fistula which some people call "first" day: go to the location of the fistula and fill it with it; and then pause in that fissure as subtle as its form: And put into it the quantity of one ounce of melted lead; and take your hand with a gentle touch, and do not harm the patient so that the melted lead does not penetrate into his eye; and know that you pause on top of the patient's eye wrapped in alum water or water, for lead adheres to the location of the fistula and cures it through marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with the water that we have said about cauterization and healing, that is good; and if not, then immediately it is necessary to make a cut of the nose and reduce the fistula to the body of the nose according to what will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Eighteenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On Cauterizing the Crack of the Pot.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Many times accidental cracks occur on the lips, and most often on the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you cure those cracks with the water that we have said in the divisions and your treatment does not take effect, then immediately ignite the cauterization small cutlass according to this form that is learned:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And be the curvature of it according to the subtlety of a cutlery.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	And then pause that initial application with care in those cracks until the cauterization reaches the bottom of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Nineteenth Chapter.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On Cauterizing Fistula in the Mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the throat of uvula or on the palate or on the roots of teeth an apostema forms and becomes swollen, and then breaks and is antiquated, and the swelling bursts and a fistula is formed, and you cure that but your treatment does not take effect, then immediately know that you must ignite cauterization according to the quantity received in the fistula; and then put that ignited thing into the track of the fistula, and take your hand until it reaches the bottom of it, and at the end of it do so one or two times; and then cure that with water as we have said about healing until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore if the pus is absorbed and is healed, that is good; and if not, then immediately it is necessary to uncover the location and expose the corrupted bone according to what will come in its own chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Twentieth Chapter.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On Cauterizing Teeth and Softening Gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are damaged, and you cure them with medicines but it does not conform, then immediately place the patient's head on your seat, and ignite the cauterization in the form which will come to this, namely that you pause the quill over the tooth and insert into it the ignited cauterization rapidly, and take your hand a little so that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth being reached.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and immediately repeat the cauterization several times according to your will.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should blow his mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, and then stop, because the damaged tooth is closed and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupted moisture is dried.
Capitol .xxi.	Twenty-first Chapter.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On Cauterizing Toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is due to coldness, or if there is a black spot or worm in it, or if the patient does not conform to the treatment with medicine, then immediately know that the cauterization in that case should be done according to two manners: either cauterizing with the border of cows, or cauterizing with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterizing with the border is that you take the border of cows and boil it in iron water, and then take a piece and wrap it around the extremity of the tent, and immediately immerse it in boiling border, and pause it over the painful tooth rapidly until it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then immediately repeat that several times until the virtue of fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, submerge the wool or cloth in the boiling border mentioned above, and pause it over the painful tooth, and then pause on top of that with hot iron until the iron reaches the bottom of the crack of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	But in any case, the cauterization with fire is that you attend to the quill of iron or steel, and it should be in the core of it some roughness and the sharpness of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
