E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corrosion is treated with acute medicine for several times, since it is half in the location of a cauterizer.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But nonetheless, cauterization with fire is more helpful.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the cure of it with acute medicine in the division, and therefore take that when you will find occasion.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the Cauterization of Knots and other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many times it occurs in the left parts of a sick foot that is called a knot, and it is a great, deep-seated cause which causes the foot to be lame; and cauterization in those places is done in two ways, namely with fire and with hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cauterization with fire is when you ignite the concave cauterizer resembling a vulture's beak, which is made of iron according to the quantity that contains the knot of all parts, and it has subtle margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then pause the ignited cauterizer on the knot, and then rotate your hand with the cauterizer in the circle of the knot until the cauterizer penetrates to the depth of the knot.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And then leave off from that for three days until you begin to see improvement.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply an emplaster to that place with wild mallows thrashed with salt, and leave the emplaster on that place for one night, so that it will be eradicated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that place with flesh-generating remedies until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it does not convert, and many times accidents occur on the surface of the body, mostly in the arms and legs, then it is necessary that you administer cauterizers with water; and this is done by taking a quill made of iron or bone or vulture's beak, and placing it on the knot; and then take a small amount of hot water, and place your hand on it, and rotate the quill with compression of your hand all around, so that the edge of the quill presses on the root of the knot, and the hot water flows back into the preconception of the root of the cauldron; and wait for the patient a little while to experience the mordication of the hot water for an hour, and then remove it, since the knot with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus do for those who are afflicted and then proceed to the other, until you have reached all of them in their own place within the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then cure those who have had the roots of the knots eradicated with this remedy, and with these remedies which cause flesh to regenerate.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 54.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the Cauterization of Tremors.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When you find that someone is affected by some tremor due to irritation of the nerves or due to fever caused by irritation, or for another similar reason, then it is necessary that you cauterize that place with four cauterizers or five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with one cauterizer; and also on the feet of him, and on his stomach with an olive cauterizer.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the trembling of him ceases and hastens the health of the diseased body.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the Cauterization of Accidental Bleedings in the Body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body there are accidental bleedings and pustules that open up which are made from gross corrupted matter; then it is necessary at first to apply, as appears, a cauterizer on top of the fistula with a subtle cauterizer made of myrtle wood, the extremity of which is extended with fire; or with the roots of long-lasting erestology; or with a lentecular cauterizer.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes it is necessary to cauterize again at the beginning of its expulsion according to this manner; and do not believe, and is interrupted the surplus causing those things, and heals from those.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	But nonetheless it is necessary that this be done properly with evacuation through phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter 56.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the Cauterization of Accidental Bleeding due to Incision of Artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many times it occurs that an artery is cut which causes a wound to open up, or the incision of apophtosis or cauterization of a limb, and afterwards similar things occur, and it is difficult to treat that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, as it happens to some people, then you should take your hand and apply a cauterizer to the opening of the artery, and place that on top of it with the aforementioned pressure many times until the bleeding from the artery is stopped, and so that there is no more.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then pause in the fire with olive cauterizers, small and large, in a few numbers, and exhale upon them until they are thoroughly ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take from those one small or large cauterizer according to the location and wound where the artery is broken, on that vein, hastening more than you have already removed the aforementioned blood, and place the cauterizer until it absorbs and restrains that blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the opening of the artery when you remove the aforementioned and extinguish the cauterizer, then take another cauterizer carefully among those which are prepared in the fire, and therefore do not cease to do this again until the blood is restrained.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And beware that you do not burn the nerve which is here, and that another mischief comes upon the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, then it is not possible to restrain the blood in those cases, and even more so when the artery is large, unless by one of four means: or with a cauterizer such as we have said, or through extraction when it is not extracted, for when it is extracted, the extremities are burned and the blood is restrained, or that it be tied with thread or with ligature by strong constriction, or that medicines be applied to it which have the virtue of restraining the blood; and be strengthened by a poultice with decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers restraint with thread or ligature and constriction with cloths or by position of concurring causes and similar things does not yield until late.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the doctor is not present nor medicine, then work with the aforementioned pause on the opening of that vein just as we have said, and understand by great constriction to stop the blood from the superior part of the wound, and on the artery do not remove what has been removed; and above the artery be sprinkled with hot water of great coldness until the blood is congealed and thickened; and more certainly in cases where there is a need for cauterization or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begins the Second Part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	On Incision, Perforation, and Vents, and on Phlebotomy, and Wounds, and their Similarities.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all the diseases in which cauterization with fire is suitable and with medicine that concurs, and the occasions and causes of them, and the instruments necessary in those cases with the forms of the cauterizers; and we have arranged the chapters according to the subordination of the head down to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And you will proceed in this chapter by that same method, so that it may be clarified for whoever seeks this, then on what has been asked.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before you begin this, it is necessary, son, that you learn that in this chapter it is for fear of what is said in the first chapter on cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And therefore it is necessary that there be great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter many times evacuation occurs which is with blood and in which lies the life of the patient; and thus it is necessary to be cautious when applying the cauterizer to the vein or incising on the apostema or warning of exitura or purging the wound or extracting an arrowhead or incising a peyra and their similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And from all these there is accompanying fear and trembling, and in the most of them death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that over you does not fall this in which is the situation, for sometimes case of necessity requires you to take ways of men with many methods of diseases.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of these some may stray away with their own disease and it is light to them for him to die, and thus through the intensity of what they find in their disease, and through the length of their disease, and with the disease is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And from these some may be those who give you their son and daughter, you expecting health for them, and their disease is mortal.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore it is not necessary that you consent to him who comes to you with this manner; and your caution be greater than covetousness and rapacity; and do not presume any cause on that except true scientific certainty which verifies what you have, and by which succession praise is achieved.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your sick patients prophesy and indication of that which is converted into salvation, for in that there is to you aid on acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, sons, God inspires your understanding and does not withhold from you direction and protection, for this is in His hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And you have ordered this chapter distinct by chapters according to what preceded in the chapter on cauterizers, from the cure of the head down to the feet, so that it may be clarified for you what you ask about this and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the Cure of Water which is contained in the Head of Children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this disease often occurs in children, especially during infancy and childhood, when the fontanel is still open.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it occurs due to a hidden cause which is unknown.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have only seen this disease in children; and all those whom I have seen were on the verge of death, and thus it was shown to me left undone work in them.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen that a child whose head was full of water, and his head was always magnificently swelled so that he could not stop it from flowing forth through the greatness of his head, and more so that the moisture increased until mortal fire.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this moisture either accumulates between the bone and the skull, or accumulates below the skull on the forehead.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For the operation in that case if the moisture is between the bone and the skull and the apostema is small, then it is necessary to make an incision in the middle of the head with a fissure in the latitude, and the length of the fissure should be about two inches so that the moisture can flow out, and this is the form of the spatum:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the moisture is more increased and the apostema is greater, then there are here two fissures according to this method:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the moisture is below the skull, the sign of this is that you must open the commissures of the head on all sides and the water is squeezed out when you compress that with your hand to the inside parts and it is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	It is necessary that you make an incision in the middle of the head with three fissures according to this method:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And then apply the incision to remove all the moisture; and then strengthen the fissures with cloths and poultices; and then broach this over with vinegar and oil within five days, and then loosen the ligament and cure the wound with tents and bandages, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little moisture so that the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another way of making an incision, which takes into account the magnitude of the apostema and the collection of water, for sometimes it is greater in the occipital region, or in the anterior part, or on the right side, or on the left side; and therefore attend to the incision where the apostema appears and the accumulation of water, and do so according to what seems best to you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not cut the artery and avoid bleeding from the wound, and thus the patient dies due to the flow of blood with evacuation of moisture.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	On the Incision of the Arteries which are near the Ears, called Hilasseysse.
Capitol segon.	Chapter 3.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When there are catarrhs or rashes on the eyelids or feet, and this is old, and you do not expect any healing from medicines, then the last resort in this case is the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore it is necessary when you want to incise those which the patient's head swells, and apply pressure on the spot with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear; and then strengthen the neck of the patient with some cloth; and consider where the vein pulsates; and the spots of each one over the spots which are near the ears, and as much as they are hidden except in certain men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then mark the artery with a tent, and then incise each one with the spatula of each side going up to the bone and incising into it, and so that this is done according to the latitude of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the spatula below the artery and cut it at that point where it meets the incision in the sides above.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And be the length of the incision about two fingerbreadths, for when some vein is incised, the blood flows out with pulsatile emission, which jumps forth by frequent leaps.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear at the incision, then it is necessary that you measure from the ear the quantity of space equal to three fingerbreadths, and mark with a tent, and make an incision into the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And what flows out as blood is a quantity of vinegar. and very little flows out of it more or less, and all this is according to the quantity which appears from the virtue of the disease and the accumulation of the artery in it.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the wound, and therefore if there remains on the bone some cause of the forehead, then incise this to prevent the apostema from becoming inflamed.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the wound with poultices and bandages of linen cloth, and cure this with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the Extraction of the Arteries which are in the Temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When old age or catarrhs arise from the temples, caused by excessive humidity and quality of the lacertae in the temples, or very ancient and similar to those, and is treated with the methods of medical cure and this does not bring comfort, then we have resorted to extracting the arteries in the temples, or cauterizing them as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the method of the operation and extraction is that the patient swells the skin which is on the temples; and understand the artery which appears in the temple, because it is shown to you by its pulsation, and is hidden except in a few men due to the intensity of pressure.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then strengthen the neck of the patient with some cloth; and apply pressure on the spot with a rough cloth or evaporate the spot with hot water until the artery appears manifestly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the spatula, which has this form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you scrape the bone with that [spatula] with ease until you reach the artery; and then get into it on one side and extract that from the upper parts until you extract that from the bone and discover those tunics which are below it, from all sides.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is slender, then you must surround it with the extremity of the oncus, and then incise one side of that according to the quantity by which the extremities of it are lengthened and contracted, and do not allow a flow of blood, for if they are not incised, the blood will not rise at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate the blood with vinegar. until three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then it is necessary that you divide it into two parts with a double thickness of cedema or with cords at length, and do not allow putrefaction to occur before the consolidation of the wound and prevent blood flow.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then incise the superfluity which is between two bandages; and do this at that hour or almost another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize that with a cauterizer into the bone and cauterize it with a cauterizing knife until the extremities of it are incised, and stay in place for that middle work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is better work if the patient has fever or is in a heated complex; for cauterization is one of those causes that help to finish the final moistures, and therefore it is better in judgment.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary to extract the arteries that fill the old wound, and be paused above on decently made powders, and then be cured with dry medicines that make the flesh and with some remedies until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you work another time bleeding occurs from the artery, then you must apply yourself to restrain that blood, or with a cauterizer, or what fills the old wound, and strengthen your hand until the blood is restrained.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if no cause of those is present to you, then pause your hand over the spot until the blood is congealed, and envelop the spot with hot water of vehement coldness so that the sharpness rests, and be strengthened according to what is needed.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And what is easier in extracting the artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cauterizer having two handles, because you have marked two spots with a tent, and then put each one aside, entirely burning, so that they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places, in order that it may be lengthened what is between the extremities of it, since they are not consolidated at all with this cauterizer.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form of the cauterizer:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two handles is example.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But even if the sharpness is less than two handles, it is better, because if they are as sharp as two handles close to each part and do not cut the flesh with velocity.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, when there is some thickness in those [handles], it is held that the heat of the fire is in those and the flesh is cut off slightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better than all work and easier.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the space which is between the two handles is the quantity of the thickness of the said [handle].
Capitol quart.	Chapter 4.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the Cure of Eyes Afflicted with Sharp and Acid Tears of the Hidings.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When there are acid tears, and the body of those veins which are above the forehead of the head appear outside, and no cause of medicine brings comfort to this, and the face of the patient is already inflamed and feels like wandering about on its own front, as if it were a procession of ants, and the eyes of that one are exhausted, moistened in such a way that their eyelids are constricted, and the eyelids are scalded by the sharpness of the tears, the ancient physicians mixed in the cure of those with this operation, and called that cure "spassa".
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the patient to rub the skin which is on their forehead, and then incise three fissures equally distant on the forehead according to its length.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the fissure measures two fingerbreadths: one fissure should be equally distant from the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length of a small movement of the lacertae which are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other side.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And guard yourself from incising the arteries which are in two sides, and stretch your hand along the continuation of both mandibles.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision is equal to three fingerbreadths adjusted.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if you have a piece of sponge applied or dry cloths moistened with the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula of two sharp extremities, the form of which is as follows:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the part of the temples to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape away the entire bone which is between two incisions on the skull, and then make this move into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then grasp the spatula and enter into the first incision again with another instrument which is called a cauterizer, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And pause the blade of that cauterizer so as to cut off the flesh attached to the bone, and the blade of it cut into the bone, and fill up that space until it reaches the middle fissure, and cut off all the vessels that descend from the head to the eyes.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But it is necessary to continue the incision up to this point on the bone, and then make this move in the middle fissure into the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And when there is a quantity of blood equal to that, express the places of the clots of congealed blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then pause in each fissure a layer of old wound, and pause above those powders imbued with vinegar, oil, and vinegar mixed together, so that there may not be inflamed apostema.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day loosen the bandage and administer great abundance of hot water or tepid water, and then cure this with ointment based on balsam and rose oil and others until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the Cure of Tears by Cataracts and those descending from the outer parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When some people have severe cataracts and continuous ones, and their eyes are exhausted small, and the management of theirs is debilitated, and their eyelids ulcerated and with their case their skin, and in the forehead of the head there is a sharp pain leading to exhaustion consequent, then it is necessary for you to know through these accidents that the materials and cataracts do not come from but few veins of the outer parts proceeding.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure for those is this: that you command the patient to rub their forehead, and then incise a fissure in the middle of the forehead, a little bit longer (and starting from the left temple into the right temple; and be incised into the bone; and stretch your hand from the lacertae of the temples which are opposite to the mastication), until the bone is revealed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry up all the blood with sponge or dry cloth, and then fill in between the two lips of the incision with old wound or with cloths soaked in it.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strengthen above on those powders imbued with vinegar and oil, so that there may not be inflamed apostema.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you have done this and see that the apostema is already diminished, then it is necessary to cauterize the bone until it begins to show flesh, and then cure that with an emplastic remedy which makes the flesh come out, just as if you took two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophony and mixed them together, and from this made a poultice and administered it in these wounds at the time of natural birth.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the Cure of that which is in the Ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	All the causes that are in the ears are one of four species, for either it is a mineral pyrrhus or a similar cause like iron and lead, or it is from a plant like cypress or fava, or it is a fluxible cause like water and vinegar mixed together with their similitudes, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when pyrrhus catz in the ear or another cause similar to those causes that do not adjust or believe in the ear, and pause the ear at the sun, and if you times the pyrrhus, then it is necessary to distill into that some cause of violet oil or musk, and then administer the extraction from there, and make the stornutacio to happen according to the conditions, and stop up the nostrils until the event of stornutacio.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then pause in the circuit of the ear some cloths or woolen fabrics, and stretch the ear to the upper parts, because many times it is forgotten with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if not forgotten, then administer extraction from there with the instrument called epicyclic gestures, which is as follows:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is forgotten with the gestures, then it is good; and otherwise, then administer the extraction from there with a subtle oncus of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore, if not forgotten by that, then make a needle of iron and insert the extremity of the needle into the hole of the ear and seal around the needle with wax and softened oil, in order that nothing but the needle may be left.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract from there with your own breath by strong attraction, because many times as we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if not forgotten in this manner, then take from a lamp or from a well-prepared vessel with which birds are caught and obtain a small quantity of it, and place that at the extremity of the ray, and then wrap around that spot decently placed.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the hole of the ear with ease, and then dry up the ear from the humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore, if not forgotten by all the causes which we have recounted, then you must take care to cut that before it becomes inflamed or spasmodic.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting that is: first, you must bleed the patient from the saphena vein and extract the blood according to the virtue of it, and then make that cease between your hands and convert the ear into the upper parts, and finally, make a small incision in the root of the ear opposite to the grey hair of it in the place where it was previously prepared.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And the incision should be in the shape of a moon until it reaches the pyrrhus, and when the pyrrhus is blackened, stop that if you can with appropriate instruments; and then close the incision at that hour with speed, and cure that until it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause falls in the ear is one of the fat that swells and becomes inflamed, then administer the cure and extraction from there; but if it does not obey your order, then you take a subtle spatula according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer to that the removal of that fat which has fallen into the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it has already become humidified by the vapor of the ear, and pause that in many cloths, and then extract from those with onces or with subtle gestures, or by incision as we have said, because it is alleviated the extraction from there.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water which has entered the ear, it is necessary for the patient to use stornutation with conditions at first, and fill their own ear with some old wound, and then place that on top of the ear where the water is, and if forgotten by this, good; and otherwise, take many sharp iron needles and lemons according to the length of the finger, and heat those in the fire for a little while, and then have the patient insert one of those into the hole of their own ear and press upon one side of that partition and strike another needle against the needle which is below the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore, do not cease this with a pyrrhus until all the water has been forgotten.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And already the water will be forgotten in such a way that you take from paper or from parchment, i.e., and place one extremity of it into the ear and extend the other extremity with fire until the middle of it is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then place another parchment and do this as many times until all the water is forgotten, and extract that with a needle just as it was said above about the pyrrhus extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of animal matter that enters into that ear, if it is a small amount, just as much and similar to it, cure that just as we have said in the division; but if it is from a large body which appears in the sense of the vertebrae, then administer the extraction of it with gestures and onces, and the cause of it is more lighter than all other causes that fall into the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of worm born in the ear, when you cure that with what we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations, and do not confirm your cure, then it is necessary for you to look at the ear towards the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if any cause of worms appears here, then extract that with gestures or with subtle onces; but if no cause appears, then take a needle, broad and above which this is the form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And then insert the subtle extremity into the ear according to the quantity which can be tolerated by the patient; and then suck on that with strong suction, and do this many times, until all the worms are forgotten.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not obey your order, then you must plug and close in the circuit of the needle with wax just as we have said; then administer those distillations which the ancients have already tried in the cure of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then is your effusion with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make that of silver or of iron, broad and above, with a small hole in it.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore, just as they are driven to that which is in the conquest of the needle's continent, here where it will be necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the reed and wrap it around the extremity of it decently cut, and then pour oil into the concavity of the ear, or the juice of some herb, or whatever you want from these medicines in the needle — and that is in the ear —, and then insert the reed with a cut above and press with your hand that on the medicine in a gentle compression until the oil is expelled into the concavity of the ear and the patient feels the oil outside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is inserted into the ear is already scarred with fire, a little bit.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And beware that the cause which you distill into the ear is not too hot, for the medicines of the ear cannot tolerate this.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the Cure of Ear Blockages.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Some times certain children are born with the vents of their mothers not perforated, and this already happens in some men, blockage in the ear canal due to wound or flesh nothing in that; and this blockage sometimes occurs in the forehead of the trauma of the ear which does not consent to the vertebrae, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in the forehead of it, which does not comprehend the vertebrae, is in the major difficulties of difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that which comprehends the vertebrae, it is necessary for you to pause the ear of the patient towards the sun and look at that.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore, if there appears an obstruction, open that with a subtle spatula of which this is the form:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of it is in the ear where there is a small latitude, with one part sharp and the other not; and the spatula has two lion's claws to prevent any harm to the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore, if the blockage is due to born flesh in the ear or in the ear canal, then extract that with subtle onces and cut that with vehement facility until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the blockage is in the forehead of the ear, then take a subtle reed and heat it slightly with fire, and then place that in the ear canal.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore, if you have sensed blockage with what the patient has obtained with facility, by weight of air, press the oppression of it with facility; and beware that you do not harm the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then pause in the ear a cloth of linen according to the quantity of the breadth of the hole which you have wrapped around with Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the wound, or that you take some water and pour it into aqua and pulverize over it in a sieve and use it; and if at times the ear is already inflamed, then it is necessary to extract the pus and replace it with another pus which you have wrapped around with cerote made from rose oil, until the inflamation subsides; and then cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if there is bleeding, then submerge a sponge or cloth in hot water and pause over the ear, and use another cure that constricts the flow of blood, which is mentioned in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the Cure of Athazil, which induces to the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Athazil, which induces to the eyelids of men and women, sometimes is moist, at other times it is dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, it is necessary for you to take those with tenhallahs or onces, and cut them with the spatula of their roots, and then pause over the places sifted.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain with bleeding comes, then you must cauterize those with a subtle cauterizer lunar.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is when you apply it to the incisions and many times they return when there remains some cause of their roots; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Cure of Grandeysssa which comes to the eyelids of men.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Many times it develops in the eyelids of men some cause which is assimilated to grandness in its strength and hardness, and therefore it is called grandeysssa.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an aggregation of thick moisture in the eyelid below and above.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the operation in them is that you consider whether the grandeysssa proceeds from there in what appears from the eyelid and is made to all parts; and the cause of it is light.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, make an incision above that with a small latitude, and then search for all parts of it with facility until it is evacuated, and then suspend it with a needle and cut it.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you are not prepared to make the incision of it, or only push it through the eyelid with a small incision by little and little, then this will not help in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is great, then you must adjust it with a suture; and cure that until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is little, you will not suffer harm from that because the agent of it restores that and embodies.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the grandeysssa is declining to the outer parts of the eyelid, then you must remove the surface outwardly, then ease the eyelid and suspend the grandeysssa with a needle, unless you need an incision, and press that in all parts; and if the eyelid by incision is lengthened, this will not help in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the eye with salted water; and cure that place with water which embodies until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	On the Cure of Axirnah in the eyelid above the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcirnah is a grayish condition which is generated in the tunics of the eyelid above, and most commonly affects children, aggravating their eyes and causing them to weep; and they cannot gaze at the brightness of the sun because tears are shed upon them.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And for this reason you should often wash their faces, and sleep on their faces; and thus the humid upper eyelids, which have already covered with inflammation, are in imminent danger of appearing in the eye; and when you press that place with those drops I mentioned, you will find inflammation within them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And one method of operation is this: the patient places their own head in the hole, and then pauses a cloth of linen and wool, and makes a cauterize, and makes a circle according to the quantity which contains arthernach from all parts; and then pauses that over that place and presses with those drops I mentioned throughout so that inflammation is aggregated in the middle of the circle; and then makes an incision in the middle of that moisture with a spatula having a fissure by latitude, and the fissure should not be greater than the one made in flabotomia.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the forehead it is necessary for you to cut the cord entirely until you reach arthernach, because in the most difficult situations arthernach proceeds through a fissure according to the form of white grey.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, extract that with cloths which you have wrapped around between the eyelids and the outer parts, and revolve between your right and left hands until it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And beware that you do not adjust in the fissure, lest with the spatula you may not reach the eye and cause it to be damaged.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you do not see arthernach at the beginning of the fissure, but rather that you adjust in the fissure a little with facility until arthernach processes; and then extract that just as we have said; and then submerge cloths of linen in water and vinegar and pause them over the place and strengthen those with powders.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And thus some that are troubled by salt, pause it in the concavity of the fissure because this which remains of that moisture.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if there is apostema in the place cautious, then cure that with gentle poultices until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On Methods of Touching the Eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of men, there are those which are natural and so ancient, then those no longer belong to the eye and cause endearment methods of maladies such as constant tears and softening of eyelids and skin, until this becomes a cause of destruction of the eye that is called touching the eye, and it cures in four ways: or by cauterization with fire; or by acute medicine according to what is said before in the chapter on cauterization; or by atactini through incision and suture; or by cannas as I will say.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore it is necessary for you to pause the patient's head in the hole; then convert the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is converted, good it is; and if not, insert an agulha into that in which there is a thread from the outer part of the eyelid, and make the agulha penetrate with the thread above, and thus - right next to the edge of the eyelid where the hair is - next to the hairs, and pull the thread upwards with the palpebra, and convert it with the ray.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then make an incision in the outer part of the eyelid below the hairs with a spatula inscident of the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor; and then extract the thread and pause below the eyelid with small powders of cotton or cloth, and then send [it] over the eyelid with a tent, and be like a figure of mirth.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But nonetheless it is necessary that the figure be according to the quantity of elevation of the eyelid, for this is already diversified in men, for some are those which require that a great quantity be incised from the eyelid, according to the quantity by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then make an incision with the spatula on both lines which you have marked, and begin from the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision is right next to the natural hairs like it is the thickness of a king.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the needle in one of the two angles of the cord, and then excise that entirely, and then adjust with the incision the two lips with a subtle wool thread or a fine thread, and wipe away the blood, and make what is superfluous from the threads adhere to two upper eyelids with some causes that are visible, if you wish to do so, and if not, do not cure.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then loosen the suture of the threads within three or four days, and then cure that.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound open and cure that with what dries and strengthens, for the eyelid is raised because of the closure of the wound and the aggregation of pus; but suture is better. And thus I say so to the ancients of touching.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But meanwhile there is solicitude over the patient, and it is a good operation, and not in haste.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And it is another method in touching, and it is that you mark on the eyelid a figure like a bunch of myrtle, and then lift the eyelid with three unguents separated and gathered according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible to have the unguents, and this is not equated, then take a needle with thread and insert it in the middle of the figure, and enter one end into the lacrimal major and the other end into the lacrimal minor, and adjust between the two eyelids the threads with equality, and then raise your hand with equal elevation, lift all the cord above which is marked as we have recounted.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips of the wound with suture, and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if apostema occurs because of your incision or your wound, cover that apostema with cerote and lukewarm water, and with unguents.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes the eyelid becomes converted to its own hairs, then it is necessary for you to use in that what we have said about incision; but suture in all cases is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Atactini by cannas is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	and it is that you convert the eyelid and cut out the figure which is below, according to what I have recounted; and then by art make two cannas or two subtle astals of which the length is according to the length of the eyelid and the latitude of them is less than the latitude of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already incised in the extremities of each part, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	And then add each one with subtlety over what is superfluous from the eyelid of the eye, and constrain the cannas of each part with a very tight stricture, and leave that for some days, because the cord will die and be rejected and will dissolve into nothingness until it falls away by itself.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then tear it off with the tweezers, and then cure the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, when it is solidified, the eyelid is elevated and the hairs do not prick.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two cannas which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and has the quantity of length and latitude neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	On the Elevation of Pricking Hairs in the Eye with a Needle when the Hair is Hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hairs are unnatural, hard and rough, and prick the eyes, then the operation in this case is that you take a subtle needle and insert it into that thread of subtle silk and lion, and then adjust the extremities of it and notice each one in a very subtle manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And the length of the threads should be of the quantity of one palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you compose another subtle thread below it in brief, and unite the extremities of that if you wish.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient's head in the hole, and be right next to the sun so that your work is declared, for it is a subtle and minute operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the hair adjusted as needed with skill, and make it penetrate the eyelid swiftly until you extract it above the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull out the hair until it is above and insert it into the alligator's mouth, and be the hairs one, two, or three, but not more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand away with that until the hair is pulled out with the alligator's mouth in the eyelid above the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if the alligator is attracted and does not pull out the hair, then attract the alligator to the parts below with the thread which you have composed there, until it pulls out the alligator from above.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then look at that with the vision of the eye, for you will pull out the alligator and the thread, and gnaw each one and claw the eye, and leave the claws for two or three days, until the hair adheres to its place and grows over that good flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.
