E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see that it is a yellow or black, hard, and the patient does not feel any sensation, then do not touch it, for it is gangrenous.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is whitened and has moisture, then you should place the once in it, and cut into that with a fine spatula, and cut it off completely; and if blood flows out during your operation, then pause over it with a bandage pressed, so as to stop the bleeding.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work so that you have treated it with the complement of it, so that it is washed with vinegar and salt; and cure that one with the other cure in a similar way until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the Extraction of Apostemes from both Ears and that which is nothing in the Golauro and other Apostemes.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When there is a growth in the Golauro which is nothing, so that the glands which are assembled together become swollen, which swells out and are called two ears, which when you cure them with what we have said in the division and it does not heal, then you should consider if the aposteme is hard, yellow-colored, without sensation, then do not touch it with iron.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is red-colored and the root is thick, then do not touch it with iron because of the flow of blood; before that, let it be mature, and then either you will break it or it will break itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is white-colored, rounded, and the root of it is subtle, then that one should be cut.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation in this is that you consider beforehand your operation whether the aposteme has already settled or if it is diminished by some diminution; and then make the patient sit before the sun, with his head in its proper place, and open his mouth, and take hold of his tongue with an instrument very noble of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or iron, and be as subtle as a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then when you take hold of that tongue and the aposteme is shown to you, and you cut above it with the same veil, then take a once and place it in the amnella, and pull it out to the outside parts as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Or another thing that pulls some cause of the tunics, and then cut into it with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is assembled with forceps, however the extremities of it are curved, so that the orifice of each of those is in the end of another, very sharp, made of Indian iron enveloped.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not with you, then cut into it with a spatula of which this is the form of it: And be sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And then, after you have cut into one notch, cut into the other one in this same manner of cutting, and then let the patient gargle with vinegar water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is bleeding, let the patient gargle with water decoction of scorsa of myrrh or fern of mirta and similar to those stiptic causes until the bleeding flux is stopped, and then cure that one until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes there are other apostemes in the Golauro besides those two ears, and cut into them according to what I have said in the cutting of two notches equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have already treated a woman with an apostema which was born in her Golauro, which apostema tended towards yellow, without sensation, which had already closed the Golauro of hers, and she breathed with great difficulty, and had already prohibited herself from eating and drinking water, and was on the verge of death if I had not intervened within a day or two.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the apostema had grown so much that it had eaten away two rumps and was coming out through two holes.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	So I cut into it forcefully and stayed in one of them once, and pulled out that thing, and it came out from the great part, and then I cut into the other notch, and then I forced her mouth open, and grasped her tongue, and then I placed the once in that apostema.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut off a great part of it, and only a little blood flowed from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	And then the Golauro of that woman was completely absolved, and she began to drink water and eat food again. And I did not cease cutting into that apostema many times for a long time, and successive apostemas arose in its place, which I cut into until it was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	And then I made it well and cauterized the Golauro of her, so that there was no addition; and then I walked around and did not know what God had done for me.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the Cutting of a Hovel when it is Apostemated.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the catarrh settles in the hovel, and it is apostemated and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is on the back part large and rounded, and then it is called a boil.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is cured with the water that we have said in the division, and does not confirm your cure, and only sometimes the apostema remains of it and becomes subtle, then you should cut into that which is added on roundly; and if it reaches that length, and is sanguine, yellow-colored or black, and has no sensation to it, then you should hesitate in cutting into it, because there is fear for the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you cut into it according to the manner that I have said of its whiteness and length, then make the patient sit down and take hold of his tongue with an instrument of which its form is processed, and place the once in the newness, and pull it down and cut into it with one of two instruments which are mentioned in the cutting of two notches.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And it is necessary that you do not cut into it unless it is adjusted to the natural term without addition, because if you cut too much, you will impair his speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And then use the instrument that we have recommended in the cutting of two notches, and cure that one until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is terrified by the cutting of it, then use force in the cauterization of it without fear, and the manner of the cauterization is only with sharp water, and you pause the head of the patient in its proper place, and then grasp his tongue with the instrument that we have said, and take from the water which we have said in the chapter on cauterization, and bring to life with it, and pause it not thick or subtle, and fill the concavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	So that the extremity of it is in the concavity where the medicine is paused, just like the concavity of a spoon, and pause the instrument with the medicine on the vulva, and the patient will stretch out his arm over his own lap so that he can spit saliva or mucus from the mouth of that one because of the intrinsic medicine, so that it does not descend to any cause on the Golauro of him and that he may recover.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then take your mouth and the medicine, and express it over the uvula for the space of about an hour until you see that one being darkened and soothed by the biting of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a cloth and wrap it around the extremity of the ray, and submerge the cloth in the medicine, and introduce the ray with the cloth into a tube above until the cloth adheres to that tube, and do this many times until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the uvula, and then let it be quar it will dry out and fall off within three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, repeat it, and then cauterize with a gentle touch in the circuit of the uvula wrapped in cloth, and purify with that what is in the circuit of it with the medicine, and be washed with vinegar water, and be cured externally with embrocation, and internally with gargling until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this type of cure is more saved than cutting and more long-lasting in fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is cured with water that is more subtle than cauterizing and cutting, because it is cured through subfumigation in this manner: take calament, yseop, origan, ruda, Arabic sycamore, camomile, and similar herbs to those of plants, and adjust all or some of them into a bath, and let them be submerged in vinegar water, and boil; and the bath should be well stirred with a decent stirrer, and there should be a hole in the middle of the bath over which is placed an instrument of iron or silver according to this manner.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And the extremity should be introduced into the mouth of the patient so that the vapor can reach the uvula on the tongue, until the uvula is quite obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat it many times until it is dry, and be careful not to do this cure at the beginning of the appearance of apostemas, because it would adjust too much in the apostema, and you should not do that, but rather wait for the declaration of the apostema of it first.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if you don't have this instrument, then take a reed and shape it into the extremity of it a seal of clay, so that the mouth of the patient is closed, because the seal of clay prevents the vapor from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the Extraction of Thorns and that which adheres in the Golauro and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many times thorns or spines of flesh or some other cause adhere to the Golauro.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you must extract that which is apparent from those thorns or spines of flesh or some other cause, on which the sight falls, because you grasp the tongue with an instrument in front of the sun, so that it may be declared to you what is in the Golauro.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which does not appear and is hidden from you in the Golauro, it is necessary to make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because then the attached cause of the Golauro will be forgotten through vomiting; or that the patient drinks a glass of vinegar or of radish juice or a small cup of dry bread; or takes a sponge from the sea and binds it tightly with thread, and then makes the patient swallow it, so that when it reaches the place where the thorns are and is extracted, then they will be forgotten.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And also take an eel and bind it with thread, and then place it inside and slowly extract it; or take a horn and then place it and then remove it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if the patient is not forgotten of those causes which we have said, then take an instrument of lead according to this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And be more thick than a ray, a little bit, and at the extremity of it be a concavity which you will introduce into the patient's Golauro with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And it will raise its head up high and be careful that the touch of its bone in the throat is not felt by the patient, so that he does not feel pain or discomfort from the bone or spine, or that it touches his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But meanwhile the patient that enters is mine, by virtue of my knowledge of the location of the attached cause and its descent into the lower part, and pulls his hand with the instrument towards me, all according to the quantity which has been prepared beforehand until it is forgotten.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the Extraction of Bloody Discharge attached to the Golauro.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the bloody discharge is medicated with the water that we have said in the division of cure by medicines and it does not confirm, consider then in the Golauro of the patient at sunset, because you have grasped the tongue of him with an instrument which we have recommended to you.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then if you find the bloody discharge, extract it with a small once or with subtle gestures decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible to extract it, then take a concave tube and introduce it into the Golauro of the patient, and then pause in the concavity of the tube a heated iron, and do this many times (until the bloody discharge is dead and falls out of the Golauro) and abstain from giving the patient any water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a full vial of vinegar water, and wash the mouth of him with it, and wash his mouth with that; and do not swallow any cause or spit out the water for an hour after washing his hand, because the bloody discharge will soon come out as soon as it senses the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not forgotten of what we have recommended, then subfumigate the patient with cinnamon or assafetida through the instrument which we have recommended for the suffumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, and it will come to pass.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And this is another manner of operation in suffumigation of that, namely: you take a bath where the coals are burning and the bath is covered with a covering in the middle of which is a hole; and in that hole, shape the extremity of the instrument; and then apply the subfumigation; and place the patient's mouth on the end of the tube, and close his mouth so that the suffumigation is not forgotten until you know that the suffumigation has reached the bloody discharge, for the bloody discharge will soon come out.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not come out, then you iterate the suffumigation many times, and abstain from giving the patient water to drink, and make him eat salty causes and herbs, and do not give him vinegar water, and thus it is necessary that with this regimen it will be forgotten.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which the bloody discharge is drawn from the Golauro when it is seen; and it resembles forceps in shape, such as tweezers, but with some curvature.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the Golauro, and the extremity of it resembles the beak of a stork, which is curved, with a serration of lime, so that when you grasp any cause, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the sermon in warning about apostemas and their section.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	The apostemas are many species, of many manners, according to the remembrance of them, each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And thus diverse in their perforation and section by two manners, of which one is by the species of apostemas itself, and because we grasp the humors.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second manner is proper to the places in which they occur in the body, because the apostema that occurs in the head is another from the apostema that occurs in the buttocks; and the apostema that occurs in a bony location is another from the apostema that occurs at a joint; and each of them has its own judgment by operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And besides, some apostemas are such that they must not be perforated, but rather allowed to mature in those places or complete their course.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And some apostemas are such that they must be pierced when they are crossed, and not allowed to mature according to their natural course, just like the apostemas that are proper to joints. For an apostema when it comes near a joint is prolonged within the circuit of that joint until it corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, causing a contraction of that member; or it is an apostema proper to a main limb, and if you delay the perforation of it until it becomes madura for the main limb; or it is near the anus, therefore pierce it before it becomes madura; and do not pierce it when it is already crossed, but only that which is proper to the anus, so that it does not trouble the prepuce and be elongated towards the parts outside of the anus, and become a fistula, or that it becomes in the end what is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But it is necessary to know the hour of the perforation of the apostema, and that is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you know that it is mature when there is the abatement of pain and the cessation of fever, and then the decrease in rigor and pulse, and the sharpness of the head of the apostema, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And therefore it is necessary to know that the perforation should be done in the place most distant from the apostema and most near to the cure of the Eminence.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the perforation should be done through the length of the flesh or the body, if the apostemas are in the parts of the arms or legs, and in the location of the lacertz, cords of nerves, arteries; and, finally, in all locations where there is no reflection; because in those that are reflected, use perforation according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	And when the apostema is in a bony location, then it is well that you do not pierce it before the digestion of it has been confirmed according to its natural course, just as we have said; because if you pierce it too early, the body of the abscess will be prolonged and many unpleasant consequences will follow, and indeed the lips of the wound will be thickened and its depth increased.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some apostemas should be pierced according to the latitude of the flesh or body, as necessity demands, or according to what the member requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And it is necessary to administer a small perforation in some apostemas, and a large one in great apostemas, with wide or many sections according to the diversity of the size of the apostemas.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are the apostemas in which it is necessary to have the cord cut and tied off when it becomes as if bread and butter, and when it reaches a term that has already stood, just like those that occur in many cases of dubelics and bubos.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of these there are some that are cut off with a section having three angles; and of these, there is one that is cut like the figure of a myrtle leaf, just as those apostemas of the Angonari.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And among them are some in which a round section and a lunar section are administered, and similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But as for the one that is not like the superficial apostemas of leons, you should pierce it with a superficial or flat perforation, only so much.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And it is necessary when the apostema is large and has collected much pus, to pierce it and not wait until you have extracted all the pus at once; having removed one part, and then covering the apostema with another day, and then removing a larger part, and then doing this many times according to graduation until it is forgotten.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And most especially if the patient is of a delicate virtue, or woman in childbirth, or young child, or old person in decrepitude, because the animal spirit many times is resolved by the exit of the pus, and soon the patient dies, and you open them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore keep this chapter with great caution, and properly administer the perforation in which you pierce these apostemas, so that you clean off the plagues and consider then whether the plague of the apostema is small or is a flat section, then you should administer some of the old or fresh remedy; and if the apostema is large, and the fissures of the perforation are many, then it is necessary that you pause in each opening until they come together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the apostema an part of the cord is abscessed or has been concaved in the circuit, then it is necessary that you fill it with old cloth or a piece of fabric soaked in hot water, just as when you treat pans or razors, so that their moisture is eliminated; and strengthen it within three days; and then process it and cure it with whatever remedy is needed for the swelling until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if bleeding occurs during the time of your operation, then you should administer vinegar water and vinegar in which a cloth is soaked, and place that on the location of the bleeding many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then it is necessary that you administer a remedy and cure, and powder those which I have recommended in many places of this our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in the time of winter, and the location of the apostema is near many nerves, then it is necessary that you envelop powders in wine and hot oil, and place those on the locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in the summer, and the locations are fleshy, then it is necessary that you place powders mixed with water and oil or with wine and oil, and all this should be applied three times a day, just as we have said, and then it is necessary to remove the apostema and cleanse it, and administer the remedy as needed until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And thus is this what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of apostemas universally, but according to the method of distinction which I have already said, each apostema in its own way is treated by specific chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the section of apostemas which come in the cord of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the cord of the head, small apostemas, and species of knots which contain tunics that are made to their own uses; and the species of them are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And among them are pustules, and those that contain humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And among them are those that contain humidity similar to powder, and resembling their own kind; and those that are lithoid, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the section of all and in the extraction of those, there is no fear, since the extraction of those does not cause contrariety to the arteries.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in section of those is that you express them with an instrument, the form of which is similar to this, which is called "entromes", until you know what they contain.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	So if that which contains is humidity, then you should divide it by section according to its length, with a superficial section in this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begins from the section of the line .B. to the line .G. Therefore, when the humidity is evacuated, then you should excoriate that part which contains that humidity, and do not leave any cause remaining, for many times it returns if some cause remains.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then submerge the cloth in Egyptian ointment, if present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill it with that which fills the wound and leave it for another day, since in this way you will corrode all that remains of that peel.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then repeat the process over that cloth with Egyptian ointment, second and third time if needed, until you are confident that there is no remaining cause of that peel; then cure the wound with ointment until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the apostema contains fatty knots, then you should incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the form of a cross, and cut once between two lips of the section and scrape off all that part, and exert your virtue in extracting the tunic which contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your arteries make opposition, then do what I have told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the lithoid apostema of section and cure according to what we have said; and the section on the lithoid apostema is less laborious, because it has little blood and little moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are some of these apostemas that are in the head of certain men, and which have no moisture; the cause of which is because you had incised on an apostema in the head of an old woman and then poked the apostema with a spongy, ashy, white substance that could not be bent, and if anyone touched it with that, it would wound.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other apostemas that occur on the head, this is not the same chapter, just as those that come to the heads of children and cause hair loss, but the section of all these should be a superficial section.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the perforation of those at the lower part of them, so that the body of the pus may be alleviated in the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then cure those with what is needed for that of curing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the section of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these apostemas appear in the neck and armpits and groin; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, and many that are generated between them, and all of this scrofula is surrounded by its own tunic, and just as with the nodes and apostemas of the head, just as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the species of these scrofulas are many, because some are lithoid, and some that contain humidity, and some that are malignant and do not submit to cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that one which you consider to be of good disposition in the Tocament, whose color is manifest and is akin to the color of the cord, and is spread out over all parts, and is not annexed to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the arteries, and is not swollen, it is necessary that you incise it with a superficial section from the top part of the body down to the line .G. up to the line .B., and scrape off all that part, and extend both lips of the cord with one or many strokes if needed, just as we have said in the apostemas of the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more cautionary not to incise the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And if the spatula is not well adapted to your hand and incision, or if you disturb the patient, or if you incise something that is not necessary to be incised; for if you incise a vein or artery and then prohibit yourself from performing your operation, then stop in the wound's triad of wounds or other powders which prevent bleeding, strengthen the wound, and leave it until the apostema's sharpness subsides and the wound becomes softened and begins to heal.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is abscessed.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire about the sign that your teacher said would indicate if there is any remaining cause of other small scrofulas; therefore, incise those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the great vein, then do not incise that scrofula from its roots.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	But it is necessary to leave that alone, and not touch it with a doubled force, and let it fall of its own accord without causing harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cloth that you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment, and then cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise that scrofula entirely, then it is necessary to adjust the two lips of the wound and cauterize them as soon as possible so that there remains no superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you find that there remains some superfluity due to the greatness of the scrofula, then it is necessary to understand how to incise the root of it, and to cauterize it and administer sutures according to what has been said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And that of the scrofulas which contain humidity, pierce it with a superficial perforation at the place where it appears to you as the location of maturity, and pause the perforation from there down to the lower part of the body, just as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer the perforation with a powder and similar to those, in order that it may corrode what remains of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then, when you see the wound already cleansed, cure it with an ointment of genital flesh until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the section of the pith of the apostema that occurs in the groin area.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	They called this section in the epilhot, and it is not seen by any man on our earth that has made it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the sermon of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men with hemorrhoids, it is necessary to avoid the extraction of the epilhot, since through this, there will be no benefit for that reason, because all the veins and major vessels of the malady are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have apostemas in the mouth or groin or two armpits, when the malady is not in the cane, it is necessary to use the section of epilhot to escape the destruction which is made by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, it is necessary to incise the epilhot behind three circles of the circles of the epilhot, or four with a small section for latitude in that which is between two circles by quantity, so that the section is in ciphac, not in cartilage, and this location is suitable for the section, because it is free from flesh and the vessels of blood are nearby.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is cautious, it is necessary then that he extends the cord of the groin with one stroke, and appropriates the cut to the canal, but avoids the vessels of blood if he sees any cause.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incise the ciphac according to what we have recounted; and it is signified on the section of the canal by the flame which is from that place and is broken up with water and for the abscission of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the hour is returned to which perforation is feared, add two lips of the cord to the wound, and cauterize it alone without touching the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that make the flesh heal until it is healthy.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And thus says Albucasis that the summary of the sermon which we have recounted is an exposition only to see that some of those apostemas have already filled up the groin area of the malady, and the malady has come to a point of death, and the ale of life has been extinguished, and some will go to incise the epigloss so that the malady may breathe over the site of the wound through some respiration, and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And therefore I command to leave the wound open until the malice of the malady is consumed; and it is a malice that lasts for three days; and thus I command to close the wound, and cure it until it is healthy.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what you have seen through me is that a servant took a cote and placed it in his groin area and incised with it a part of the cane of the lung, and I was called to the cure of him, and he began to cough as if it were the dying man's last breath, and uncovered the wound and began to bleed little blood from the wound.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore you were confessed that it had not incised a vein nor guided, and the breath was coming from the wound, and cured it until it was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And did not happen to the servant except that he regained his voice, and then some days later returned to a state of better disposition.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say to you that in the section of the epilhot there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	On the section about an apostema that occurs in the groin area outside and is called a hernia of the groin.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This apostema is called a hernia of the groin and it is a large apostema according to the color of the body, and it is often found in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is according to two manners, whether it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural one there is no need for cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is according to two manners of which one is similar to grassy nodes and the other manner is similar to an apostema made by the constriction of an artery, and in that there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And it is not necessary to make an assumption about it as iron except in that which is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should proceed to investigate that and examine it according to what has been said, and if you find it similar to grassy nodes, and it is not suspended from any of the veins, then you should incise it as with the nodes, and extract that which contains it, along with the skin and bursa; and otherwise, you should thoroughly investigate all its being, and then cure the location where it requires curing until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the section of the species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of the nodes, many species and you have already said all their species in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is necessary that you recount thus the difference between a node and an exitura, as it causes doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore I say that in an exitura there is heat and fever and violent pains until the ebullition of the superfluity is cooled down; and it is completed putrefaction which then ceases the fever, pain, and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But in a node there is no heat or fever or pain, and it contains that ciphac lion which is in its own sac.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and its beginning is like a cheese and it is made thus as if from a vacuum, whether major or minor, and they are according to two species, either fatty and containing humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, according to what you said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you arrive at the cure of a node, it is necessary that you expose it and inquire about it from the beginning with an instrument which is called an intro-mes, according to what will come in the chapter which is approaching this.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the manner of inquiring about apostemas and all nodes, that you take this instrument and introduce it into the most humid location which you find in the apostema, and you turn those said parts with it little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the cord.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then withdraw your hand according to the measure of the greatness of the apostema, and then extract the intro-mes and consider what is situated in its wake.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the flowing humidity is forgotten, of whatever color it may be, then you should incise it with a superficial section according to what I have said in other apostemas.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the wake of the intro-mes there is no humidity, then you should know that it is fat.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it over it with a section having the form of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	just as you are taught, and suspend it with an onyx, and excise the cord of all parts with ease, and preserve the skin or sac, if possible, over that and extract the pus from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation, it is not possible to extract that pus, and many times it happens that way, and then you should extract it by force until there remains no cause from it.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if there remains no cause from it, either little or much, the node will return to its original state.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you find that there remains a small part from it, then complete the wound with some sharp, corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, and pause over that which seats the apostema cautiously, and cure that other way until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node, then you should cauterize the two lips of it and cure that with what enfles.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the pulse is absent from it, or not pulsating, then you should compress and humple the site of the wound which is wet and leave that straight for two or three days until the wound is cleansed and the ebullition of blood subsides; and then return to incising what remains of the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	On the forms of the instruments necessary in section and perforation.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of those so the forms of intro-meses are, and there are three species, that some are great, and some medium-sized, and some small.
La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:	The form of the great intro-mes is this:
La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The form of the medium-sized intro-mes is this:
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The form of the small intro-mes is this:
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	They are made of iron, with a handle of wood, and with rounded extremities, in such a way that they facilitate the insertion into the apostemas.
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the forms of the instruments, and they are named after their uses, and one of them is called a berid.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And there are three species, that some are great, medium-sized, and small.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The form of the great instrument, its shape is:
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The form of the medium-sized instrument, its shape is:
La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:	The form of the small instrument, its shape is:
Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	Conveniently, these forms are for those apostemas and exituras and fistulas and bubos, in order that they may be used among the bones and other causes.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And there are needles, large and small, lions, just as great hooks with which the shrubs are sewn together, and they are made of earthenware citron, or earthenware, or iron, or silver. And the best ones are when they are made of earthenware citron.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	And there are instruments of black lead, which are adapted to those who wish to be proficient in the conquest of fistulas in the cavities where reflections occur, that they may be reflected back with their lightness upon those reflections.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	And there are three species, that some of them are long, and others medium-sized, and others short, according to the quantity of the width of the fistula and the constriction of it.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	Form of the great instrument of lead:
Forma del experient migier de plom:	Form of the medium-sized instrument of lead:
Forma del experient petit de plom:	Form of the small instrument of lead:
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	The forms of the onyches are many species, that some are simple, which have only one curvature, and there are three kinds: great, small, and medium-sized.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And among them there are onyxes of bone, and there are three species.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And among them there are onyxes that have two curves, and there are three species.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And among them there are onyxes that have three curves, and there are three species.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all these are necessary in their place.
Forma de unci simple gran, forma de lu:	Form of the great simple onyx, its shape is:
Forma de unci simple migier:	Form of the medium-sized simple onyx:
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	Form of the small simple onyx, its shape is:
Forma de unci orp gran:	Form of the great onyx of bone:
Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	Form of the medium-sized onyx of bone, its shape is:
Forma de unci orp pauc, forma de lu:	Form of the small onyx of bone, its shape is:
Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:	Form of the great onyx with two curves:
Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	Form of the medium-sized onyx with two curves:
Forma de unci pauc havent dos curvaturas:	Form of the small onyx with two curves:
Forma de unci gran havent tres curvaturas:	Form of the great onyx with three curves:
Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	Form of the medium-sized onyx with three curves:
Forma de unci pauc havent tres curvaturas:	Form of the small onyx with three curves:
E aquestas so las formas dels scalpels am les quals son seccatz e scorjatz les nodes e le apostemas, e so de tres specias, quar de aquels es gran, migier, e pauc.	And these are the forms of the scalpels with which nodes and apostemas are cut and scraped, and there are three species, that some are great, medium-sized, and small.
Forma de scapel gran:	Form of the great scalpel:
Forma del scapel migier:	Form of the medium-sized scalpel:
Forma de scapel pauc:	Form of the small scalpel:
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The extremities of those with which section is made are sharp and the other extremities are not sharp, and they are not paused in such a way that there is made justament in the excoriation of nodes the fear of incision of vein or nerve, and for those to be healed the patient and bring tranquility a little by the adjustment which is found necessary for the excitation of the apostema.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the forms of amalgaids, and there are three species: great, medium-sized, and small, just as veins.
La forma de magda gran:	The form of the great amalgaard:
Forma de magda migier:	Form of the medium-sized amalgaard:
Forma de magda pauc:	Form of the small amalgaard:
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made of earth and resemble a ray that is used to extract oil.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it has on the left extremity a punctured point with a hidden spatula and in that course it runs through the inner and outer parts, when you want, just as you see.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The forms of spatimis, which are hidden between the said means of perforation of apostemas and do not perceive the sick, and there are three species: great, medium-sized, and small.
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	And these are the forms of those:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The forms of venous tubes through which the flow of blood is diverted, and there are three species: great, medium-sized, and small; the forms of them are:
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made of earthenware citron, rounded with some length, and they are subtle.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And it is necessary that you have these three species of venous tubes: great, medium-sized, and small, so that through them the flow of blood can be diverted with speed in necessity, and then when it first happens, there is no medicine.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, you should not use them to divert blood in all parts of the body, and you should only use them in fleshy places, just as in the ligaments of the hips and thighs, and in the ligaments of the arms, and breasts, and belly, and groin, and similar to those of fleshy flesh.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And sometimes they are made of those small instruments resembling scissors according to this form; by which the blood is diverted when it is made by phlebotomy, or incision of vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes they are made round according to this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the cure of the breasts of men which are similar to those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the breasts of some men become inflated as they begin to be full-bodied, and accordingly, the breasts are swollen, and similar to those of women, and resembling apostemes, distant.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And to him who has this condition, it is necessary that you incise those with a lunar section according to this form, from the line of B to the line of G, and accordingly, excise the tumor entirely, and accordingly, fill the wound with a medicinal flesh-coloring, and accordingly, adjust the two lips of the wound with stitching, and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast declines into its divisions and is softened by its magnitude, just as it does in women, then let it be cut into two halves along their natural lines, with two sections resembling a lunar figure, of which each one is contained within the other, until the major line contains the minor one according to this form from the line of B to the line of G. And accordingly, excise the cord that lies between the two lips of the wound, and stop the bleeding, and administer what we have said about suturing and those powders which are necessary for the cure until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of that which needs to be cut for the restlessness of the patient and the flow of blood, then let it be filled with a poultice submerged in corrosive gallnut and leave it until the corroding liquid that is left from the grayish matter is gone, and accordingly, cure that until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the perforation of apostemas that come forth through the navel.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	Those apostemas that come forth through the navel are of the species of scrophulas, hard ones, which contain a sack.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And of those, some contain humidity; and those that contain humidity must be incised with a lunar section according to this figure: from the line of G to the line of B. And when all the discharge of blood is evacuated from the apostema, then you should fill it with a poultice and leave it until the next day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, the poultice should be stopped and cured with a suitable dressing for that wound, until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the apostema is of the species of nodes or scrophulas, then you should incise it on top just as we have said in the section about scrophulas equally.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	And if the wound is extended in such a way that it would be a bother to poultice, then you should administer in it a cauterization according to what we have said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the section of apostemas that occurs through artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is broken and the cord that lies over it is consolidated, then many times an apostema occurs. And the signs by which it is known that inflammation and apostema are through the artery or vein: for when the apostema is through the artery it is long and swollen in the groin of the body; and when you impel the apostema with those said parts, you will feel a stridor in it.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is through the vein is swollen around the visible part of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the section on this apostema is an error, and more so in those that are located near the armpits, and in the groin, and in the neck, and in many other parts of the body; and it is very great, therefore it is necessary to avoid its cure with iron, and that which is in the extremities or at the head should be avoided.
