Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But in that which is caused by inflammation of the orifice of the artery, incise a section on the cord in the long direction; and accordingly, cut the section with scissors and accordingly, open up the artery, and deliver the tunics until it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And accordingly, tie on top of that needle and make it penetrate into the other side, and strengthen the artery with double thread in two places, — which cause is necessary for you to sew up two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And accordingly, push the place that is between two ligaments with a spatula until all the blood that is in it is let out and the apostema is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, administer the cure in which power is generated until the ligaments fall off; and accordingly, cure that with suitable dressings for that wound until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an apostema caused by section of the vein, then you must take with your hand as much water as is possible from the apostema and the cord, and accordingly, insert the needle below the place that you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and be in that double thread until you extract that from the other side, and accordingly, tie the apostema with two ligaments just as we have said to you about the ligament of grapes for two parts with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will break, then accordingly insert a needle with a thread under the entire apostema, and make the first incision of the needle, and strengthen those threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	And accordingly, cut the apostema in the middle of it so that when you have extracted what is inside it, then you should incise the excess cord and leave what remains tied.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, pause over the poultice which you have submerged in wine and oil, and accordingly, administer the cure which is made with some and dressings until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 50: On the apostema that occurs due to twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as the apostema occurs in artery and vein, and similarly the apostema occurs in nerves when it occurs in their percussion or twisting, and due to excessive strain, and for similar reasons.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made in the most part of the body in the locations of the joints or the ankle, or in any place where the articulations are faulty.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a grave apostema, and it is similar in color to the rest of the body, and it is located in the major parts of the body, disposed in its own way, when it is tightened with vehemence, as if the patient were in a state of stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an apostema that grows in the groin of the body, and therefore it is left behind the cord, and it is faulty to all parts and does not go to the parts before or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, in those that are in the joints, it is not necessary to be treated with iron, because it would very easily cause contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But that which is in the head or forehead should have the cord removed with a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is an apostema of little size, then take away that part with forceps and incise that part to its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then you should suspend that part with thread, and excise that part, and accordingly, stop that bleeding; and adjust the wound with stitches, and cure that until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the section of apostema which occurs in the cheek that occurs at the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	I will describe to some men that are often found in the bellies of those and in other parts of their bodies which are called fungals by similarity to those with fungi, from whose roots is subtle and whose head is large; and now the lips of those are converted, and it is of those who is small, and it is of those who is very magnificent.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have already seen one, and in its belly were two theils which resembled fungi more, and there was no difference between those white ones, with small roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And now the lips of those were turned inward and were fissured, and moisture flowed from that at all times.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, you should incise them and weigh in one pan 18 ounces. and the other weighs 6 ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in the incision of theirs is that you consider, when the patient is humid, and the color of the theil is white, humid, with subtle roots; then you should incise them with a spatula, and be present at the time of the cauterization by the fire, because many times the section of it expels much blood; and if you see the blood flowing, cauterize that.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if the patient is poor and timid, beware of incision with iron; but then take a thread of lead that has been made recently, and strengthen that theil, in the manner which we have said; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And accordingly, adjust it in the constriction of the lead thread; therefore, do not cease to strengthen the lead thread strongly on that theil, until it is cut and falls off by itself, without any effort.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the theil is of large roots, then in the incision of it there is some cause for fear and dread, and more so in that which is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But possible is that you cut away most of it, and accordingly, cauterize that so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And accordingly, cure that until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And beware that you do not presume to incise a theil which is of dark color, of little sensation, with no regard, for that is an abcess.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come back in memory of cancer, accordingly.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the cure of a swelling at the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	A swelling at the navel is caused by many reasons; or by fissures of the cicatrix which is above the belly, and the yarn or budgel comes out according to the way it has been torn in other ruptures; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery, as has been said before, or by a constricted ventrality in that place.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is caused by a fissure of the cicatrix and the bursting forth of the yarn, then the color of the apostema is similar to the color of the body; there is no great pain, and accordingly, it appears in diverse situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is caused by the bursting forth of the budel, then the situation of that part with water as we have recounted, with a more vehement diversity; and when you press that part with the said threads, it becomes hidden, and accordingly returns; and very easily it comes out again, and it is magnified much with the entrance of heat and violent labor.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is caused by humidity, then there is no pain and it is not hidden when you press with your hand, nor is it constricted or creased.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is caused by blood, then accordingly the apostema appears with these signs declining towards blackness.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is caused by nothing but flesh, then accordingly the apostema is a serious one, large and hard, and is fixed according to a quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is caused by a constriction, then accordingly the touch of that part is painful.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in that case is that you consider whether the swelling at the navel is caused by blood from an artery, or a vein, or constriction; then it is necessary to be prohibited from curing that, because there is fear and dread thus as I have taught in the chapter on apostemas caused by arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the swelling at the navel is caused by the budel or yarn, then it is necessary to command the patient to take hold of his own hand and be standing upright; and accordingly, make a sign with the thread in the circuit of all the navel, and accordingly, command him to stand between your two hands on his shoulders, and accordingly, circulate around the navel with a spatula in the location which I have marked with the thread; and accordingly, extend most of the apostema to the upper parts with strong thread or cede, and tie it in the circuit with a firm thread or ceda, and do so decently.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And accordingly, take the middle of the extended apostema and insert the said thread into that indication and guide the yarn; and if you have not found nor guarded it by the thread, then accordingly, extract the rest and push the yarn to the lower parts of the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the thread, then take that with a thread; and incise the excess parts of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then accordingly circle around that part, and accordingly return to your operation; and take two needles and insert them into those two strong threads and enter the two needles in the circuit which you have made around the apostema in a cross-like manner, making them penetrate; and accordingly strengthen the apostema in four parts above the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the place until the flesh extended and falls off by itself; or incise that part when it is softened and becomes pliable, and accordingly cure that with water as needed, until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the swelling at the navel is of flesh only or due to humidity, then it is necessary that you conquer the apostema as we have said and extract the blood or humidity which you find in it, and accordingly cure that with water as needed, and consolidate the place.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De curacio de cranc.	On the cure of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said in the division, about the type of cancer and how it is treated with medicines, and what a hindrance is in its cure by iron so that it is not ulcerated; and we have said that cancer is generated in great caution and carefulness in its treatment.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients have said that sometimes cancer is in a place where it is possible to eradicate it, just as with cancer which is in the nipples or in the armpits and similar to the members allocated to remove all that, and especially when it begins small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, it does not become necessary for you to take possession of it, because I have never seen nor heard of anyone curing that, nor has it ever come to my attention.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation in this case is when it is allocated as we have said, that you precede and leave the patient and purge with black bile some times, and accordingly sign it, if there is a clear and manifest repletion.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And accordingly, prepare the patient with preparation in which it is located for the operation, and accordingly prohibit the use of those threads which are needed for that; and accordingly concave all parts with a good cord to avoid any cause of roots remaining.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And accordingly, let the blood flow and do not incise it slightly, and express the places, and wash away the blood thoroughly with your hand or with an instrument of which you are master of the tools.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you encounter opposition from the flowing blood in incising a vein or artery, then accordingly cauterize that until the flow of blood is stopped, and accordingly cure that with other treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54.
De curacio de ydropici.	On the cure of dropsies.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted in the division, about the types of dropsies caused by water, and the signs of each type, as well as the treatment with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured with iron is only the type of dropsy caused by black bile alone, and it is not approached with iron to the type of dropsy caused by yellow bile or that caused by corruption, because this is deadly.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have already medicated this type of dropsy caused by yellow bile with medicines and do not confirm your treatment, then consider that if the patient has already been debilitated, or is afflicted with another illness, such as dropsy again, just like it is in the lungs or belly and similar to those, then beware that you do not treat them with iron, for fear is above that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you find the patient full of virtue and in that condition there is no other illness but dropsy alone, and not young nor old, then the manner of the operation for that is that you lift the patient between your hands, and minister to them accordingly by emptying their belly with their own hand, filling the water at the outlet of the pentenilh, and accordingly take a spicula according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	to be of two sharp parts long, with an acute extremity just like a spatula; but however there should be in it some smallness little by little, so that in the operation on that part you do not pass into the budel and lead it.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And accordingly consider if the generation of dropsy is from the parts of the budels, because then it is necessary for you to make the section with a spatula that is three times as long as those parts left behind, in the right side of the belly over the pentenilh.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of dropsy is from illness of the liver, then accordingly your section should be on the left side of the navel for three times.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of dropsy is from melancholy, then accordingly your section should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And it is not necessary for your section to be on the side where the patient wishes to lie, so that the superfluous fluids do not flow to that location freely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And accordingly pierce with the instrument all the cord, and accordingly enter into that section, and lift your hand with the spatula between the cord and the siphac, and you excise it; and if it is as much as a fingernail or thereabout.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And accordingly pierce the cicatrix until the spatula reaches the location where you want it to be, and that is the location of water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And accordingly extract that and enter with an instrument whose form is:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a silver cannula; made of silver or iron or lead lion, to which at the lower part of it there is a small hole, and on its sides are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and made is the extremity of it inscribed according to the manner of a feather, just as you see:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And in the extremity of it is an armor, because when the instrument reaches the water, then that so soon descends upon the instrument, thus evacuating the water in a moderate quantity; for if you evacuate more than what is necessary at that hour, very easily the patient will die from resolution of his animal spirit or by approaching death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate from that according to the quantity of the virtue of it and according to what your disposition is to the patient's virtue, pulse, and good condition.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And accordingly extract the instrument, and retain the water which is caused because it is held back by the cord which retains the hole that is on the cicatrix of which I have recounted to you that you should pierce that according to this manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And accordingly repeat the instrument to another day if the patient tolerates this, and extract a small quantity of water, and make it so for some days over fear, and beware of error until there is only a little water left.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient, and leave a great quantity of water, then accordingly cure that with burial in hot sand, and mix it with warm wine, and wait under the sun for a long time; and cure that with desiccative medicines until it is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And accordingly cauterize on the stomach, and the melancholy and liver in proportion to the extraction of water, according to what I have recounted earlier.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the cure of children who are born with unperforated kidneys.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes one of the children is born from his mother's womb and the head of his mixture is not perforated (or has a narrow opening or is not in its proper place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore it is necessary to cauterize with perforation of that as soon as it is born with a spatula made of subtle matter according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And accordingly pause in the opening a small clasp made of subtle lead and bind it, and let it be so for three days or four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when you wish to urinate, it will be re-formed and hardened; and accordingly return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not pause the lead, it is possible that the urine which flows over the place may not close this opening.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But that of which the opening is narrow should be medicated with a leaden clamp, as we have said, for many days until it is amplified.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in whom the opening is not in its proper place, are led to this condition because of them, that which is born and remains is at the end of the head of the foreskin, so that it cannot urinate downwards, until it raises the foreskin with its hand upwards; and it is not a natural generation, therefore the sperm cannot reach the mother according to right, and it is a bad illness.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation for that is that the patient should be bent over his own back, and accordingly extend the head of the foreskin with your left hand with a vehement extraction, and incise the head of the foreskin at the location of the perineum with an acute spatula, just as a feather is inscribed, or as you would inscribe some part, so that the middle of it will resemble the head of the foreskin and the opening will fall in its proper place according to what is necessary.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware that in your operation of bleeding flux, many times it happens thus; and pause at that point where you cut the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 56.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	On the matter of albugo, which occurs in the prepuce at the head of the foreskin and is accompanied by corruption, blackness, and adhesion of the prepuce to the head of the foreskin.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this albugo occurs in the foreskin and is an inflammation of the surrounding flesh.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And one of these two types is malignant, while the other is non-malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	Non-malignant, requires that you suspend with a subtle thread and incise it until the whole is clean; and accordingly pause above this wound, submerging it in Egyptian ointment; and accordingly cure it with this ointment until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the albugo is malignant, with a bad color, then accordingly you should administer cauterization to it, in proportion to its incision and ratio.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the albugo is in the prepuce of the uncircumcised head of the foreskin, and one part of it is inside the prepuce and the other part is outside, then accordingly you should open up the albugo that is inside first, until it is consolidated; and then you should cure that which is outside, because when you cure that simultaneously with the prepuce, it is not ensured that it will not be torn.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And also you will see that in the genitals and the prepuce there is blackness and corruption, therefore it is necessary to scrape away all that which is already denigrated and which already wants to corrupt or which is corrupted; and accordingly line upon this with a mixture of honey, which is mixed with flour of coriander seed and of three-year-old eggs, well crushed and sifted.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And accordingly cure that with the other treatment until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is bleeding flux, then accordingly administer lunar cauterization according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	because the cauterizing instrument is useful in two dispositions together, namely in bleeding flux and in a wound when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the foreskin is corrupted and destroyed entirely in an hour, then accordingly it is necessary to insert into the opening of the prepuce a leaden cannula, so that the patient may urinate through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the prepuce to the head of the foreskin (and this adhesion does not occur except in those whose prepuce is dry, and who have not undergone circumcision; and when adhesion occurs due to a wound or apostema) it is necessary to excise with an obtuse spatula until the bond is dissolved and the head of the foreskin is completely freed.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to excise those precisely, then accordingly you should excise with a spatula some cause of the head of the foreskin and the prepuce, and thus it is because the prepuce, when it is subtle, is easily perforated by its own subtlety little by little.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And accordingly separate between the prepuce and the head of the foreskin with a thread of subtle lead, which is already moistened in hot water so that they do not stick together again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And accordingly it should be treated with a warm poultice until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 57.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	On the purification of children and the cure of that which occurs to them in circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity like other wounds: but rather it is our operation and our will, and the purpose of it is properly in children; therefore it is necessary that we assign to it the better operation and way that is less troublesome to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore I say that the ancients did not write about circumcision in any of their books, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired through experience, which cause is that you have found that most of the artists and barbers use circumcision and purification with a razor and with torches; and they use a ligature with thread and an incision with the fingernail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And you have already condemned all these methods and did not find a better purification with razors, with ligature with thread that is used in purification like the fingernail, because many times the cord above has been cut off, because the cord of the prepuce has two layers, and the tone is left behind, and very easily it is forced to another incision and certain pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in purification made by the Alphecati, which is digitate, of which barbers use, it is not ensured that the incision of the extremity of the male member is secure, because very easily it enters into the wound.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with fingernail, very easily rust and corrupts your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the cord of the child is short by nature, and many times it does not need purification in this way, and I have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But from the purification that is made with razors and ligatures with thread, I have discovered by experiment, because the razors are of proportional incision, therefore the acuteness above is just like the acuteness below; and thus when you press your hand so proportionately two acutenesses, and inscribe so according to a comparison in one time; and it is made compression of the thread with a figure containing the cord of the foreskin from all sides, in which there is no error at all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you should make the child as comfortable as possible if it understands a little, and not do anything else but tie the thread to its foreskin just so much, and leave it like that until the next day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And accordingly make him happy in all that manner which is possible to you from what he receives of his intelligence.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And accordingly make him stay between your arms as prepared as possible, and not be at all anxious; and conceal the razors in your hand or leave them to rest on your lap, so that the child does not see those nor anyone else of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And accordingly place your hand on the foreskin and blow into the cord, and pull that which is attached to it until the head of the foreskin is reached, and accordingly purify that which is aggregated in the scrotum.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And accordingly tie the marked place with double thread, and accordingly ligate somewhat lower than that a small piece of thread as the second ligature, and accordingly hold the said point and indicate the location of the ligature left with good retention, and inscribe between two ligatures.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly lift the cord slightly and extract the head of the foreskin; and accordingly allow the blood to flow little by little, because it is better that way; and pause powder above and on top of the powder, pause a cloth in which is scattered the yolk of egg cooked with hot water mixed with rose oil recently boiled; and leave that on that until the next day; and cure that with treatment until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The form of the razors for purification, this is the form:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Be the outermost not cutting and the others cutting, so that the end of the claw is not reached, and the length of both acuteness be as the length of two equal hands.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in purification is because very easily the inner cord is cut off entirely or a part of it is incised.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, it is necessary that you stretch that from your hour with your fingernail in front of the wound's inflammation and inscribe it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then accordingly extract that with a thread and inscribe that.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if three days have passed and the foreskin has remained inflamed behind, then accordingly you should leave that until the inflammation is calm, and excise that with facility, and inscribe that according to what is prepared for you.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And beware of the head of the foreskin, because it will not be well there.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And therefore cure that with the powder which is recommended in the treatise on powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is incised from the cord with measure, and obeys the parts above, then that will not cause trouble there.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And therefore cure that with what we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter LVIII.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	On the Cure of Retained Urine in the Bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by oppression made by pain or by congealed blood or by pressure or by swelling, and resembles those cases that we have mentioned above regarding the methods of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved and you see retention of it being caused by pain which is already in the neck of the bladder, then accordingly the patient should be encouraged to press on their own belly.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And accordingly combine the weights of that on their own back and stretch their belly from the upper part of their back, and the patient should strain their arm as much as is possible to them.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore accordingly the neck of the bladder is constricted and has expulsion of pain to the posterior parts, so that the urine is released.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with what we have said, then a strong cause is made on the patient, accordingly it is necessary to administer an extraction of it with an instrument called syringe, whose form is this: It should be made of silver and very subtle copper, just like a tube of a swallow's quill with subtlety of ray long in similarity to a palm and a half, to which a thin cane is attached at the head.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the method of extracting urine with that is to take a double thread and tie it at the extremity of the instrument, either wool or cotton, for good binding; and insert the extremities of the thread into the rear part of the syringe, and inscribe with razors if any superfluous cause exists in the wool, but introduce it into the tube with vehemence. And accordingly, fill the syringe with border and album of egg white.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient sit on a stool, and encircle their bladder with it and the foreskin with olive oil and egg yolks.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And accordingly insert the syringe with facility into the foreskin until it reaches the root of the foreskin; and accordingly fold the foreskin upwards towards the umbilical region; and accordingly push the syringe into that; and accordingly push that into the bladder, so that it causes the patient to be relieved of the cause, and not as said before in this order, but rather the method in which it goes astray.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And accordingly stretch the thread with the wool little by little, because the urine is soaking the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	And accordingly extract that and make it for urinary cure, and use the syringe, do not stop doing this and use the syringe until the bladder is evacuated and the patient receives relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter LX.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	On the Quality of Cathartics for the Bladder with Clamp-Creed and Similar Instruments Which are Accordant with this.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When ulceration or apostema occurs in the bladder, or congealed blood is present in it, or pressure is applied to it, and you want to cause aqueous medicines to flow into it, then accordingly use an instrument called clamp-cedra, and this is its form:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	but in the extremity of it is deaf, i.e., closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three holes: two on one side, just like times.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	In the beginning it is a concave space, in which water is inserted, and it should be according to the quantity that fills it, without addition, until when some cause is pulled out by that, pulling out the humidities, and when it is expelled, with water it is pulled out, and when it is long, just as clamp-cedra pulls out naptha in naval battles.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, when you want to draw out the humors in the bladder, insert the extremity of the clamp-cedra into the humor, and pull it with that water which is inserted into the upper parts, because the humor is drawn into the concavity of the clamp-cedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And accordingly insert the extremity of the clamp-cedra into the foreskin as we have recommended in the syringe; and accordingly push the humor with water that pushes it, because that humor flows into the bladder at once, and the patient feels relief.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The form of the cathartic instrument with which the bladder is cathartized, and this is its form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it should be made of silver or lead, with the head more like a small feather, and behind it a thin cane attached.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And accordingly take the bladder of motion, and pause in it the humor that you want to cathartize in the bladder, and accordingly tie it between two with a strong ligature with double thread, and warm up that humor over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And accordingly insert the extremity of the cathartic instrument into the foreskin.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And accordingly stretch your hand over the bladder with the humor and stricture descend into, so that the patient feels relief as that humor has already been conveyed to the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder present, then accordingly take a purse made of papyrus and make from it a circle; and pierce that through all its circumference; and accordingly insert a strong thread into those holes, just like they are revolved; and accordingly add the circle just as it is added alsofatur, so that you pause in that water that you want of the humors, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And accordingly tie that to the instrument and make it as you have made it for the bladder, and express yourself with your hand into, so that the humor conveys to the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter LX.
De extraccio de peyra.	On the Extraction of Pain.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division about the kinds of pain and its cure by medicines, and the difference between pain generated in the lungs and pain generated in the bladder, and the signs of it.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said about the pain which requires an operation by hand and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the pain generated in the bladder properly is that which is placed in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you so narrate that with a manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore I say that the pain generated in the bladder is mostly seen in children; and among its signs is that the urine which comes out of the bladder is like water in subtlety, and appears on the surface; and the patient rubs their foreskin, and many times they cry out, and accordingly it is dressed; and with this you should check the anus in small pieces.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is a joyful thing to heal children of that before they have reached 14 years old; and it is difficult cure in the elderly.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young, it is easier because it is among them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that from which the pain is greater and the cure is lighter; And if it is small, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of that, it is necessary at the beginning of that to purify the patient with a cathartic instrument which extracts all the fissure that is in their intestines; for that fissure sometimes hinders the conception of the pain by inquiry into it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And accordingly, the patient should be pressed by their own weight and contained and mitigated in joy because of that which causes the pain to descend into the lower part of the bladder, or to jump to another place sometimes.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And accordingly make that sit between your most prepared arms and those of it are left the things of it, because of which the bladder is made to decline into the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And accordingly, prepare all that and everything outside.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the pain in the space, then you should sit down at once with section on it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you can't see at all the slightest touch, then it is necessary that you anoint with oil your left hand's indication of the pulse, if the patient is a child, or the right hand's indication if they are a young adult, and insert that into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And prepare for the pain until it stays behind your left hand's indication.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And convert that little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And accordingly press upon that with your left hand's indication, and push it out into the lower parts outside of the place where you have taken the section.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister to press the bladder with their right hand; and command another minister to extend the legs upwards with their left hand, and with their other hand to relax the cord which is below the legs, in the part of the place where the section is being done.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And accordingly insert the spatula which is incident to this, and this is its form:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and cut into that which is between the anus and the legs, not in the middle location, but rather before the left side of the cleft; and this section should be over that pain and your left hand's indication should be in the anus, and it should be a transverse section, so that the section outside is broad and narrow behind according to the quantity that you have extracted from the pain, up to what is possible, and not greater, because then the pain would overwhelm your left hand's indication which is in the anus and forgets its defect.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that some of the pain is angled and marred, because of which the extraction from it is made difficult.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And that water is like a lion, smooth and round, and the extraction from it is made easier.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is that to which angles and marrows belong, adjust in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not so, then it is necessary that you engender upon that, or that you strengthen upon that with decent gestures, the extremity of which should be like a file with which you strengthen upon the pain, and do not escape from it; or that you insert behind it a subtle instrument with curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot upon that, then you should amplify the hole a little, and if you see a flow of blood, cut into it with strength using vinegar distilled.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the pain is more than one, then at first you should guide your hand to the mouth of the bladder, and accordingly insert into it; and accordingly guide a little further along; and similarly do so if there are many more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the pain is very great, then ignorance is that you insert it with a large section, for you will cause one of two things to happen to the patient: either death or the disturbance of the continuous flow of urine, because of which the place is not fully consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But administer expulsion of it until it is forgotten, or generate in the fracture of it with razors until it extracts that into pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with the juice of aloe and blood of dragon, and strengthen that.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And pause over that cloth infused in oil and wine, or in roasted oil and lukewarm water, so that the apostema is cauterized.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And accordingly, lay the patient on their back and do not remove the bandage for three days.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when that has been removed, wrap the wound with water and some oil, and accordingly cure it with divine and devilish potions until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound there occurs a cauterized apostema, which is hard and corrosive, and from that it seems as if the blood is congealed in the bladder, and because of that the urine is prohibited (and this is known through the egression of blood with urine), then accordingly insert your left hand into the wound and extract that blood, for if it remains, it will provoke the bladder to corruption and putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly wash the wound with vinegar, water and salt, and with opposition to all species, in which it is necessary for the cure of that until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And it is necessary during all hours of the cure that you lie both hands on both parts and adjust the medicines which are placed upon the wound.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the pain is small and is in the meat of the foreskin, and it is fixed there, and the flow of urine is prohibited, then accordingly cure that with what you have recommended before you came to the section, for many times this cure is accused of being a section; and already you have tried this, and it is that you take a perforator made of iron and lead, the form of which is this:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	with a triangular extremity, sharp, fixed in a handle.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And accordingly take a thread, and tie it to that foreskin behind the pain, so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And accordingly insert the iron into the foreskin, piercing with ease until the perforator comes to that pain.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And accordingly rotate the perforator with your hand in that pain little by little, and you pierce the piercing of it until you make the other side penetrate; for then the urine is soon abolished.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And accordingly press your hand upon that which is remaining of the pain from the outside part of the foreskin, for that is blocked, and forgotten with urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not adapted to your equipment for some reason which prohibits it from that, then accordingly tie one thread below the pain, and another thread above the pain.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And accordingly enclose upon the pain in that foreskin between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And accordingly extract it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And accordingly remove the bandage and cleanse the congealed blood that has formed in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to tie a thread below the pain, except for the reason that it does not return to the bladder, and the other thread above, only then, because when the thread is untied near the extraction of the pain, the cord returns to its place and swallows the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And therefore it is necessary for you when you tie the thread above to lift the cord upwards, or that it should return to its original place, and swallow the wound just as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter LXI.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the Extraction of Pain from Women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Pain in women is rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if there is pain in some of those women, then it is difficult to cure it, and it is prohibited by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is because the woman herself is too modest.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second one is because you do not find a woman well enough informed to know how to reveal herself if she were to meet a doctor when she is chaste, or if she is one of the women who have husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third one is because you do not find a woman well enough informed about this art, especially the operation with the hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth one is that the location of the section on pain in women is too far from the location of the pain, so you need a prior section, and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity provokes you to do this, then it is necessary that you take a woman who is a midwife and well informed, and not too obstinate.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that one, then look for a midwife who is quiet and subtle, or present a matronal woman well versed in the nature of women, or a woman who has parted from this art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore, present her and command her to do everything that you will instruct her to do, from the inquiry about the pain to the beginning; which cause is that she should consider if the woman is chaste, then it is necessary that she puts her own hand into the anus and feels the pain.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore, if she finds it, cut it below her own hand, and then command her to insert herself into that.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not chaste, then command the matron to insert her own hand into the patient's private parts and inquire about the pain, since she should put her left hand on the bladder, and compress it with good compression.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore, if she finds it, then it is necessary that she gradually massages that from the orifice of the bladder to the lower parts, with the summit of her virtue, until she arrives at the root of the cleft.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And accordingly, insert yourself into that, approaching the midpoint of the private parts to the root of the cleft, whichever part is in front and centered on the pain, and your hand should not be removed from the pain below.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the section should be small at first; and accordingly, insert the ray into that section, and if you feel the pain, then adjust the section according to the quantity which you know will cause the pain to be released from that.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the kinds of pain are many: for some are small and great, and sharp and rough, and long and round, and have ridges.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you know how many kinds there are of it by this which you signify about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of blood, adjust with vinegar distilled and tie that for one hour until the blood is cut off, and then return to your operation until the pain is forgotten.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And prepare with you the instruments which are said in the extraction of pain in men, so that you may be helped by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood, and know that the expulsion of blood is from the piercing that is inserted, then you pause powder on the spot and strengthen it with powders and strictures descending, and do not repeat this; and leave the pain and do not extract it, for very soon the patient will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And accordingly, cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore, when the sharpness of the blood has subsided after some days, and the place is healed, then you return to your operation until the pain is forgotten.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter LXII.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On the Section for Hernia in the Groin.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia in the groin is nothing but an accumulation of moisture in the white membrane which is below the cord of the genitals containing the humors, and it is called a "ciphac".
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it is in the proper panniculus which nature prepares in the part of the humors, so that it may be cut off when it has become another humors; and it is the cord of the genitals between the white membrane which we have said, and not this but rather a "tart".
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to weakness which occurs in the genitals, by which this matter flows into those, and sometimes it occurs through a blow struck on the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity has many colors, because the color of it either declines to citrine or to blood-red, or to reddish-brown, or is blackish-feculent, or is white and watery, and that is the most common one.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.
