Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	But if the fetus is on her feet, then the attraction of it is gentle and the direction of it to the mouth of the mother is gentle.
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	But if it is constricted at the belly and parts, then it is necessary that you extract it with cloth which you will wrap around your hand, and cut open the belly and parts until the water which is in them flows out.
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	But if the other members are stuck and return to the head, then place it with your left hand; but if the mouth of the mother is swollen, then insert your hand into the pomegranate, and seek out that head, and attract it with those fingers, and accordingly, enter one or two fingers, and draw it out through her mouth.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	And if the mouth of the mother is constricted by an apostematic swelling which occurs to it, then it is necessary that you not trouble over it; but rather, administer effusion of humid and fatty causes.
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	And administer poultices; and follow the patient with waters that soften and moisten.
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	And if the fetus is on her own ribs, then it is necessary that you insert it as much as possible; and administer water which we have said for a living fetus.
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	And if this is not possible, then insert it in the feet, and extract it.
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	And make sure that you do not leave any cause behind the second finger.
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	And when you have completed all your operation, then administer the water which we have said for the cure of apostematic swellings that occur in the mother.
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	And if bloody flux occurs, then let it flow into stiptic waters and administer another cure.
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I myself have seen a woman whose womb contained a dead fetus, and accordingly, on top of that fire another pregnancy was undertaken, and accordingly, the dead fetus is another.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happened to me a long time ago that an apostema occurred in my own umbilicus; and it swelled up until it became hot as fire, and I began to sweat.
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called to the cure of it, and medicated it for a long time, but the wound did not consolidate.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	And then I wrapped it with some plaster of strong attraction, and drew out one bone, and accordingly passed several days, and drew out another bone; and I was greatly amazed, as there was no bone in the womb.
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then I thought that they were the bones of the dead fetus.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	And then I examined the wound and drew out many bones from it, the woman existing in her own good disposition, and thus she lived in this way for a long time, recovering from a small part of the arm.
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And I do not think it strange, but rather because in this is science and aid to that which the physician crafts with his hand for cure.
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	Of the forms of instruments that are necessary to extract the fetus.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	The shape of the uterus which is open in the mother:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the shape of a strengthen in which are equalized the liberties, to which equalization are two vertebrae at two extremities of two feet.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	But however this vertebra must be more subtle than the strictor, and made of ebony or boxwood.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And the width of each staff should be two fingers and a half, and the margin of one side is equal to one finger, and the length of each is one palm and a half; and in the middle place between the two staffs there are two adjustments of those staffs which are already fixed, from which the length is most of one palm and a little more, and the width of each is two fingers or a little more.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two adjustments are inserted into the mouth of the mother so that they can be opened up with them when you rotate the two prescribed vertebrae.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Another similar form to that one, more subtle and lighter:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	It is made of ebony or boxwood wood, according to the likeness of forceps.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	But however, at the end of it there are two additions like times, and the length of those additions is equal to one palm, and the width of each is two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And when you want to open her up with those, then you should cause the woman to lift herself on a lyre, and let her feet hang down, opening up what is between her ribs.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	And accordingly, work the instrument with your hand like you do with forceps, equalizing according to the quantity that you want of the appreciation of the mouth of the mother until she does what you want.
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The shape of the uterus which they called "vertitge" in ancient times:
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	The shape of impulsion, with which the fetus is impelled:
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	The shape of amiability, with which the great head is contained:
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	And it is assembled like forceps with teeth at the end, just as times, and some times it is made long like forceps according to this form, just as times, with teeth like the teeth of a rasp which is inserted and contained.
Forma de amesidat pauc:	The shape of amiability few:
Forma de unci havent una spina:	The shape of a finger having a spine:
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	The shape of a finger having two spines:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	The shape of forceps to which the teeth of a saw are attached, with which the head of the fetus is contained.
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	The shape of a spatula having two extremities at which the head is severed:
Forma de dos espatums latz:	The shape of two broad spatulas:
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All those instruments are exercised, and when the more species of them are multiplied and prepared by the artists, as it is lighter to their operation and higher in quantity.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And you should not neglect those instruments regardless of what, because the necessity of them is irrepressible.
De extraccio de la segondina.	On the extraction of the second finger:
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the second finger is retained during childbirth, then it is necessary that you command the patient to retain her breath, and accordingly, make her snort with condensation, and strengthen your hand on the mouth of her and on her nose, and if by this means it has been extracted outside, so be it.
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then you should take a cloth and pierce a hole in the cover of it, and pause on that spot where the mouth of the mother is open, as with calamus and rue and anise and camomile and Arabian senna and cinnamon and St. John's Wort.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All these herbs or some of them should be submerged in water in the cloth, and pause that on the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And accordingly, place a reed cane in the mouth of the mother, and keep it there until the evaporation comes to the concavity of the mother.
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And accordingly, make her snort as we have said, and the second finger is extracted quickly.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if the cure remains and is not extracted, then you should command the midwife to submerge her left hand in sesame oil or in a poultice of althea, and accordingly, insert it into the canal and search for the second finger, and when you have found it, then take it and extract it little by little. But if it is annexed to the womb of the mother, then enter your hand according to what we have recommended, and when you have found the second finger, extract it little by little with rectitude so that the mother does not faint from the vehement attraction.
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	But before all, it is necessary to be flexible on both right and left sides with ease.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And accordingly, it should be adjusted in the quantity of attraction, so that it will obey and escape from adherence.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the mouth of the mother is constricted, we have already recommended the cure with snorting and with medication from the cloth with herbs.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	But if it is not extracted with all the causes that we have recommended, then beware that you do not fatigue yourself on that in iteration of abstraction, but rather, it is necessary that what has come out from there to the mouth of the mother lies at the end of the woman, and accordingly, crystallize that with a poultice and tetra-pharmaceutical; for that will make it putrid after some days and be dissolved and extracted.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But when it putrefies, it is lifted to the bad air of the head and stomach, and that leads the patient astray; and accordingly, it is necessary that sub-fumigations and conveniences are administered thereto.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	But some of the Ancients have already experimented with sub-fumigation from Nazareth and dry figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	The shape of an instrument by which the woman is sub-fumigated for the retention of menses and the second finger:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It is made of beryl or iron.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And it is placed with the subtle extremity in the canal and the broad extremity on the fire, and the sub-fumigation is placed on the arms of the fire.
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And keep that there until that sub-fumigation is consumed and another iteration occurs.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	On the cure of the child's unperforated navel:
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Some children are born without a navel and their navels are not perforated, which already have a subtle and opaque cicatrix.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Then it is necessary that the midwife pierces with her finger that cicatrix; and if not, then pierce it with a sharp spatula, and beware that she does not touch the lactating area.
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	And accordingly, place on it some wool soaked in wine and oil; and accordingly, cure that with a poultice until it is clean.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you fear that it may be opaque, then place a reed cane in the hole for several days, and stop when the child wants to pass.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And already an opacity of the navel occurs due to consolidation of the wound or apostematic swelling; therefore, it is necessary that this consolidation be inserted, and accordingly, cure it with the water we have said for the cure and with lead.
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	On the cure of fistulas that are left behind:
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	The fistulas that remain in the aftermath of childbirth, lower down near the navel and larger than those which remain by the anus outside or in the space of one part.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is a fistula or multiple fistulas.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And since that node is aged and flows with white or subtle pus-like liquid, and sometimes some of these fistulas are penetrated.
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And those that are penetrated are known by the matter that is discharged from them through exit and windiness; and sometimes the patient uses a cathartic of exit, and very little is discharged from those red ones.
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And some of those fistulas penetrate into the space of the bladder, and into the urethra of the penis; and some of those penetrating ones go into the junction of the womb and into the notch of the cervix.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And the way to know if a penetrating fistula goes into the anus and not into it is that you put your finger in the anus and enter a subtle probe of iron or steel into the fistula when there is no turbulence.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if there is turbulence in that, then you should insert into it a subtle probe of lead or horsehair until you feel the probe or hair in your finger.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel that at all nor does any cause of exit or redness or windiness proceed from the hole, just as we have said, then you will know that it is not penetrating, and accordingly, go to the cure.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the urethra of the penis, then the significance of it is that urine will be discharged from it and prohibition of it to this effect that the place where medicine is consolidated.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it is penetrating into the junction of the womb or into the bone and causing pain in the circulation, then the signal of it is that the probe will pierce here if there is no turbulence in the bone, and causing pain in the circulation of the part; and that from this place there will be pus-like discharge always; and that it does not hold with that medicine, nor is consolidated with a poultice.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those penetrating fistulas there is no complete cure, and the cure of these is the labor and vehemence of the foolish doctors over which I am fixed.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in that which is not penetrating and not old, healing with iron is expected according to what you have recommended and what I have tried.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And it is that the patient lies between your knees on his back and lifts up his hips towards you, with his legs bent at the knees, so that his womb is inclined towards his belly, and accordingly, insert a probe of lead or iron into the fistula if there is turbulence in it, until you know the location where the probe penetrates.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if that patient feels pain around the navel, then it is necessary that you insert your finger into the navel.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel with your finger that the probe has already entered and is penetrating, or if you feel between your finger and that siphac or flesh, then you will know certainly that it is penetrating; and accordingly, do not trouble yourself about it, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	But however, some may say that it is healed in certain men's hearts.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And the medicine by which healing is expected in it is that you apply a subtle cauterizing fire according to the size of the fistula, just as has been preceded, and insert that ignited substance into the fistula until it spreads around the navel; and accordingly, repeat that process two or three times until you know that all those fleshy tissues adjusted to the fistula are like the feathers of an owl.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And accordingly, cure that with calques wrapped in leather until all those fleshy tissues are healed; and accordingly, cure that with medicines generating and consolidating flesh, and if it is healed, so be it; and if not, then do not expect it to be healed at any time by another cure.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe enters and does not penetrate into the navel which is in the anus, but between that and the probe which is a veil of flesh or cicatrix, and sometimes the fistula is opened on the surface of the codon, then dry the codon from the beginning of the fistula, and you will see it dried with the probe, and it will be in the fistula until the drying reaches the location where the end of the probe comes out, and through the probe is liberated and cut.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And accordingly, purify those fleshy tissues fistulated which are gathered like the beak of an owl and do not remain any cause.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if a flux of blood comes sometimes between you and your operation when you are purifying those fleshy tissues, then use the milch that is and the least painful instrument is cauterization with fire or with acute medicine, for cauterization with fire adjusts two good habits: so it is adjustment of those adjusted fleshy tissues, and abscission of blood from excessive moisture.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And accordingly, cure that with calques wrapped in leather or in three-fold cloth until the wound is fully closed, and accordingly, cure the wound with hard flesh generating and consolidating.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And such medicines in which there is dryness and excess; when accordingly it is restored, it is already healed and you do not fear relapse.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula has already reached the perineum of the anus and is prolonged from the surface of the body, then insert your finger into the anus and inquire about it.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And therefore, if you find the probe and it enters between you and her, it is veiled by cicatrix or flesh, and it is prepared for penetration, then do not perform an operation there except according to the way of faith and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The cause is to administer in that place one of three ways: either to cauterize it as we have said; or to dry it so that you can achieve the conquest of it and insert the probe into the cure prepared for it, and do not proceed with drying until you are sure that you will not cut into the lactating area containing the navel, and that nothing will happen to the patient except by his own consent; and accordingly, cure that with water as we have said, because very little is needed for healing; or to lengthen that veil and remove that pus which dries it up there in the anus, just as we have said, either with a probe or another instrument of sharp extremity, and accordingly, purify those fleshy tissues fistulated which are in the drying process until you can perform percrustation; and accordingly, strive to achieve the restoration of all the wound through drying, and if the orifice above is not consolidated, and the fistula remains open in the part of the anus, it will be easier for the patient.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And in some cases the fistula is finished according to this method: when you insert the probe into the fistula, and it is on the edge of the anus around the surface of the body with the coden and at the margin of the anus, then take hold of a perforated extremity, which is like an awl preparing the vessels according to this form:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert into that faithful package wrapped in five fingers or around those, and accordingly, insert the probe with faith into the fistula until you achieve the conquest of it.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it is penetrating in the margin of the anus proper to the outside, then you extract the probe from that hole just as you insert your finger into the anus; and extract the extremity of the probe and adjust the two extremities together, and strengthen each one, and leave it so for a day or two, and when you more deeply insert the probe into the flesh, strengthen it well until those fleshy tissues are inserted between the two extremities of the probe which fall apart.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And accordingly, cure the wound so that it is consolidated and healed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the orifice of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate, in whatever way you are prepared, but not in the perineum, because it is not your place to do so, lest you cut into the lactating area; and accordingly, make it heal until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The form of the spatula with which the fistula is opened: its curvature is very sharp and the other part is non-sharp, so that you do not cut into what is not necessary, just as sometimes.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	On the suturing of hemorrhoids in which blood flows during the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are in two ways, because either they are between the anus like charcoal, or those that are like grass of rye.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And some are small and large, and the blood flows from those at all times and is one, and many, and outside the anus, and in the extremities of it.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But however, those that are outside the anus are according to the months of little humidity, from which citrine water or a small amount of blood flows with the body continuing, and according to the color of the skin.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the cure for that which is outside the anus is that you command the patient to settle and to press it in so that the anus opens and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then you take hold of it and suspend from the hooks or what you have with your nail, and accordingly, cut those at their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	But if the hooks are not held in those due to their humidity and softness, then take them with a rough cloth or with a piece of leather or with wool floss, and extract them with your fingers, and accordingly, cut those and powder some powders over them, suitable for the incision, so that they may be applied to those as cauterizing; or cauterize those according to what is preceded in the chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And accordingly, cure those with another cure until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey evacuation, then anoint the patient with a cathartic in which there is a small biting, and wash it with that water which is in the anus, so that it may obey evacuation slightly when the patient has pressed.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then the cause of theirs is slight, and it is that you take those with your nail or that you take those with hooks, and cut them, and accordingly, cure those with water as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And the one who will make an incision should administer suturing of them according to this method: take a needle-wrapped probe and insert it into the awl and accordingly, extract the hemorrhoids at the upper parts, and make that penetrate with the awl in the root of the other part, and wrap the two extremities of the probe in the more distant part of the awl, and so laterally; and strengthen the hemorrhoid with strong stitching, and accordingly, remove the needle and awl.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do this to all of them, and leave one and not sew it up, for that reason the superfluity of blood may flow from that.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And accordingly, pause over the anus with cloth dipped in red oil or cerate; and pause that over the anus and command the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And accordingly, leave it so that it can heal; and when it is healed, cure those with ointment or another cure until they are well.
De curacio de fistulas.	The cure of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many times accidents occur due to excessive splitting or constriction of nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And when they are old and not suitable for that medicine, then you must cut those with the point of a spatula or with your nail until they are made moist and the scab above is prevented from forming, which prevents consolidation; and accordingly, cure those until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you must cut those with a reason more vehement than the first, until there is much bleeding and they are exfoliated; and accordingly, cure those until they are healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	The cure of Almesmir, this is the key.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that Almesmir is the key, and it's not just a notch red on the skin according to its color like the head of a clavicle, and it's made all over the body and most especially in the parts below the shoulders and above the elbows, and accordingly, by these pains, you must learn how to manage them.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then it is necessary to cut out what is in the circle of the key, and hold it with forceps or hooks, and eradicate its root; and accordingly, cure that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize it according to what is preceded in the chapter on cauterization.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	But truly, a verruga is a small, sharp, round fistula on the surface of the body, and many times they appear in children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the cure for it is that you stretch and cut it open, or that you strengthen it with a probe or a skin thread until it closes.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize it, as we have said, with fire or acute medicine.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And now they are eradicated inwards and outwards with the instrument which you will use.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	But a formica is a small, fatty or fistula-like prominence on the surface of the body going forward, and when the pimple reaches it, it seems to be bitten by a formic insect, and it is made around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the cure for it is that you take a reed pen or a vulture's quill, and make it strong, and pause it over the formica until it contains the circle of the reed pen in the parts of it; and accordingly, revolve your hand with the reed pen around what is in the circuit of the formica, and pause it on the navel of the flesh, and that eradicates the formica from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, do this with an iron or steel reed, according to this form:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	Be the upper part of the reed thin and subtle (not perforated), wrapped in such a way that when you apply it to the said area, it may be ablated and the revolution of it.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish, cauterize the formica according to what is said before in the chapter on cauterization of atheyl.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	The form of the instruments that are administered to give catharsis.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes it is made cathartic of silver or lead or melted iron or malleted; and sometimes it is made from those small and large instruments according to those to which they are administered, for that which is administered in the cure of little children is small; and those whose buttocks are rough or sore should have their cathartics small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of catharsis great and little.
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the reed pen above, to which the pouch is tied, should be broad according to this method; and there should be a distinction at the point where the pouch is tied in such a way as to resemble times.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the extremity of it most distant, which is inserted into the anus, should be thick and dense like a lion's fur, going back to subtlety; and on one side of it there are two holes, and on the other side one hole, and the width of the hole should be according to the size of the rays and slightly thicker than small.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the pouch should be in which medicines of animal bladder or sheep's wool are placed, and the root of it should be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be perforated with many holes, just as it is revolved; and if the space between the holes is the largeness of that.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And accordingly, insert the strong needle into those holes, which is of ten needles or nearby them; and adjust the pouch with it; and when the pouch is placed in it, be tight at the head of the cathartic between two distinguished parts with strong constriction, and accordingly, cathartize each hole: But the quality of cathartizing is that you fill the pouch with medicine, which should be warmed according to the quantity of the tolerance of the patient; and take care not to make it too hot or too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And accordingly, have the patient lie on their back with their knees bent and their feet flat on the floor, and place one leg over the other as if they are sitting on a stool; and accordingly, apply some oil or album of honey or mucilage of fenugreek to the extremity of the cathartic; and accordingly, insert it into the anus with ease, and have the assistant take the pouch and express it with two hands and many strokes with vehemence until everything in the cathartic is evacuated into the bedpan; and accordingly, remove the cathartic and have the patient lift their legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces him to evacuate excessively, take as much as he can tolerate; and if he sleeps with it for the entire night, it is better in terms of purging.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you cathartize him in the diseases of intestinal flux and evacuation, then you must iterate the cathartic until he is cured.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or apostemas (abnormal growths) in the anus, then you must make the cathartic very subtle and dense, like those used for children.
De curacio de las plaguas.	The cure for plagues.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	And I have said in the division of the cure for plagues earlier that it is suitable for a free person, and I say so too, the cure for these with me and with medicines according to complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	So I say that plagues are diversified according to how they are made and according to the place on which they are placed.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which many times plagues are made are just like getting a blow from a peyra (a type of hammer), or an incision with a knife, or a piercing with a lance, or with a fist, or with an arrow, or similar to those many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the plagues that are on the parts of the body are just like those which appear on the head, or neck, or legs, or belly, or thigh, and similar to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the cure for some plagues, by which one paces this reasoning and rule on other plagues.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will start with the simple plagues of the head, for the memory of the complex ones will come at the beginning of the fourth chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	So I say that when a simple plague occurs on the head and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it is due to a blow from a peyra (a type of hammer) or similar, and the wound has already become large and there are concerns about impending apostema (abscess), then you must apply fleubotomia (cupping) to the cephalic area at once, without delay; and extract blood according to the quantity of virtue present in it, unless there is some other cause that prohibits cupping, especially if the blood that has flowed from the plague is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And the cupping should be done on the opposite side of the affected area; and take care to keep the patient from taking in excess food, drink, or heavy victuals.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if any prohibited cause exists, then reduce the food and do not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And apply poultice to the wound, if an abscess is forming, using warm oil or wine that has been made stiptic.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is certain that an abscess is forming, then apply poultice to the wound, if it is fresh with its own blood and the air has not yet changed that powder which I recommend you to use in small amount.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed it, then apply poultice on a similar substance until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large or caused by an incision with a knife and similar, and the lips of it are not adjusted for pus, then adjust those with suture according to what I recommend about the suture of them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound is discovered on the bone and skin, and there is no retention of pus but only a small suppuration, then incise it and carefully cure the wound with medicines and restore the flesh to its natural state in that area, and command the patient to abstain from foods that are gross: heads and forms that resemble theirs, until they are composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrefaction in the code (bone) and it does not adhere to the bone, then you should incise all that is putrid and remove it, and carefully cure what remains.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these plagues there is an artery or vein from which blood can flow and it is not cut off by medicines, then you must inquire about the artery, and if you find that it is uncut, then you must cut it with a spatula or tie it; and if necessary, you must cause what we have said not to come together again, then you must cauterize until the blood is stopped.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, then the cause of them is light; so that you can powder over them with this powder, since it has consolidated before the air changes those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil of sesame, one part; blood of dragon, two parts; and no-extinct cause, three parts; mix all together well and finely ground, and fill the wound with it; and construe it by good constriction so that it adheres well to the wound, and be coagulated with blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And apply the powder above it with pills and let it be, and do not remove it until it is like that and has not become abscessed, for the medicine is not absorbed from it until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes it happens that this alone is sought out, when you do not have in your presence sesame and blood of dragon.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And already do this same operation in the great plagues when it is necessary to apply poultice over them and tighten, and so recent plagues with their own blood, which the air has not yet altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in the time of summer, then do not think about the position of this powder, but instead cure those with what we have said, by applying a poultice made from alcus enguents (perhaps a type of mold) or by applying powdered wheat flour mixed with water and honey to create a poultice; and carefully cure them with another remedy until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if there is a fracture in the bone, and it is small, then you should extract that with gentle hands.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And you should say that the cure for fractures of the head is in this which is venomous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the plagues of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the plague occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in medicine between that and a simple plague of the head.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerves of the neck are cut or an artery is injured, then if it is a nerve, do not intervene with surgery but rather avoid any cure that would cause violent stipticitat (drying or astringent properties), just like zinc and egg white which are like vitriol and similar to them that do not nourish the nerves and contract those.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not apply any cause to the plague that is all frozen, for the substance of the nerves is frozen and its continuation is in the brain, which is the most noble part of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if it is that which is cured by light medicines, just like is caused washed with sweet water, some time injected into warm or not-warm oil, and when it is washed with sweet water and the other small pieces are molded according to this manner, and moistened with gentle heat.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the plague is great, then administer suture, or tighten the edges of it, and carefully cure it with powder until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the plague has depth or occurs in the lowest part of the poultice, then pierce it at the most depressed location.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if the plague has already cut an artery and blood is flowing, then separate or dry it, or tie it off, or cauterize it if necessary, to prevent further bleeding.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the vertebrae of the neck or all have been injured and the veins of the neck are saved, then you should adjust the edges of the spine with sutures over the canal of the neck and do not touch that; instead, gently pull it and reduce it to its natural shape, and carefully strengthen it with decent stricture, and leave it for a few days; and carefully cure it with poultices in which there is stipticitat (drying) and excitatio (stimulation), until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the plague has caused a fracture in the bone, then pierce it, and if there are fragments of bone, extract all those that you can from them; and what is not apparelled (perhaps referring to a type of splinter or fragment), leave it until the plague subsides, and be separated, and the excrescence (a type of swelling or protuberance) be alleviated.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the plague is recent, then powderize over it the powder which I have recommended.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if the plague has caused a fistula, then cure it with what will come in its own chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the plagues of the neck or similar ones when it occurs between the shoulders and is made with a spatula, a knife, or a lance.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a blow from a lance or knife, and it has pierced to the depth, then consider whether there is ventosity (perhaps referring to an abscess or pus-filled cavity) in the plague when the patient complains; know that the plague is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if there is no depth in it and the plague is recent with its own blood, then you should apply powder to it at first hour, and not strengthen it so that the blood does not become retained in the depth of it and returns to the heart and kills the patient, but rather pause on it attractive poultice, and remove it twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the poultice is not at your present, then you should pause in the orifice of the plague with a cloth well-wetted so that it sucks up what remains of the moisture; and make sure the patient sleeps over the plague so that water that is in it may be adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three days or more have passed since the plague began and there is no sign of spasms, tremors of the heart, nor constriction of the soul, and times the other good dispositions are present in him, then know that the plague is saved; and then cure it with gentle and another remedy until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the healing of it is delayed, and all time has opened up, then know that a fistula has been made; cure it therefore by its own chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the plague is due to incision by spatula or knife, and it is simple in the surface of the foot or hand, then cure it with what has been preceded by suture, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if it has caused a fracture in the bone, and there are fragments of bone that have been pierced, then you should twist the plague and pull out those fragments, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then leave them inside until the plague subsides, as the extraction of them is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for the other plagues that occur in other members, the judgment in curing is the judgment of what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the plagues of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition which occurs in the belly is either great, or little, or middling.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great plague, some times it is said that the gut or nerve of the gut, by which there is an intrusion of theirs and a suture of theirs to be more violent and subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small disruption is made difficult by another manner, and it seems that the reduction of theirs is more difficult, if you do not take care to insert their intrusion into its place soon, because it swells and becomes engrossed, making it difficult for the instrument to make an entry.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is middling, because in that there is not difficulty in reducing the bowel, just as it is difficult in the two species mentioned earlier.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And you should know that the suture of the belly is according to four manners, but two sutures are common which apply to sutures of other plagues of the heart.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other sutures proper communicate with the other plagues, but however they are more proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to you whatever exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the plague is small and there is some cause of the bowel due to it, and it is made difficult to reduce that, then this is in one of two manners: or by the parvity of the disruption just as we have said, or when the bowel has come inflamed by the frigidness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this is so, then it must be that you cut open that in such a way that you immerse a sponge or wet cloth in hot water only, or that you take in water of squinant, and cypress, and spike, and embrocate with that into the bowel until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes I have found that this has a drying effect (stipticitat), and it is better than plain water in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see the inflammation to be resolved, then you should moisten the bowel with water in which is mixed a high and bitter altitude (malvas), because by this it is alleviated the instrument of it with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the instrument is excused from this treatment, then you should divide the disruption into small parts with an instrument to which they are inserted morrows.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first cure is better when it is proper and not too severe, and there is no occupation to cut too much because of necessity and faintness.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, see that its form is:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	The one end of it is bent and acute, the other end not acute, the extremity is subtle, and not like the subtlety of a spatula, but rather obtuse by a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the plague is amplified and extends outside the bowel, then it must be that its reduction should follow the form of nature in its own place, if possible above, because that is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the disruption is wide and is in the lower part of the belly, then it must be that you make the patient lie on their back, and elevate their hips higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you should elevate the head and feet higher than the parts left.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly, if the disruption is in one of the two parts of the belly, then you should pause your thought and consideration always so that the part where the plague is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it is necessary that you administer this in great plagues and in middling plagues.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small plagues, pause this that is according to your preparation, and make it so that the minister be among your most trusted assistants, who has the entire disruption within his hand and adjusts the lips of it, and accordingly uncovers from there to there what sees the suture some other cause.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suturing: take the needle, or count the needle according to the amount of the amplitude of the plague; and accordingly leave from the extremity of the disruption of the said ring finger, and strengthen the needle one, other than you do not put faith in both ends of the code, with two ends of the ciphac that is left over the code of the parts outside, until it makes it penetrate from that side; and you have already added two ends of the code and two ends of the ciphac, and so it has been made four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And accordingly strengthen the thread with double faith in the circuit of the needle, and sometimes from two parts together, and accordingly add the two lips and the plague by decent addition; and accordingly leave the thickness of the finger and put another needle in that place, and accordingly tie that with thread as if it were a feast to the first needle; and do not stop doing this until there is no further need for needles until you have completed all the contraction of the plague.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be middling between coarseness and subtlety, because fine needles barely touch the flesh; and thick ones are difficult to insert into the thread, and therefore it is necessary that they be middling in subtlety and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is not necessary that the needle be inserted in both ends of the thread at once, for fear that the flesh will not be incised gently and that the plague will heal before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And they should not be prolonged in their suture so that the plague may not be prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And accordingly, cut off the ends of the needles so that they do not bother the patient to sleep on them; and pause above the suture with powdered powder from all parts, which have the ends of the needles; and leave those there until you know that the plague is already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these species of suture with needles in this manner are more suitable for small plagues, because they require only one needle or two or around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second suture is common: and it is that you administer with suture the four ends, of the thread and two ends of the ciphac, in one go, with a needle wrapped with faithful thread in subtlety and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And accordingly, when the needle has penetrated these four ends, withdraw it from that middle part where you began, so that the thread will retract to the most superior part of the plague, in order that the suture be according to a cloth-like suture with which the cloths are strengthened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And pause between each suture the quantity of the thickness of the ring finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture is known by men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this suture, I healed the wound that was inflicted on a man in his belly which had been wounded by a cutlass, and it was the disruption of a larger wound, about the size of a palm, and it was situated around two palms from the navel and it was the disruption in the middle of the member; and then I reduced that after 24 hours since the bowel had been opened up.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was consolidated in the space of 15 days or thereabouts, and I cared for him and he recovered; and accordingly, this is what happened to him for many years, and it has been converted into his disposition.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle, it was so, for you did not apply to him the common treatment, which is not found in any place or medicine, but rather you paused over the wound with a cloth twice a day and assiduous washing with water of honey until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But you described two species of suture proper according to the narration of Paraula.
